messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-23 12:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-04 01:29:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-06-05 15:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 12:11:33.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that pip.conf templates variables properly

When a user provides values other than the defaults for
upgrade/pre, they may not format it in a way that pip
interprets properly. To ensure that we template the
conf file correctly, we ensure that it's interpreted
as a boolean, then make it lower case as is expected by
pip.

Change-Id: I91590665cd2d878b6b5ef92d1118610bb4a3fd84
(cherry picked from commit b9d90b5e81bcb27766bec04bb6f3794078506f82)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that pip.conf templates variables properly

When a user provides values other than the defaults for
upgrade/pre, they may not format it in a way that pip
interprets properly. To ensure that we template the
conf file correctly, we ensure that it's interpreted
as a boolean, then make it lower case as is expected by
pip.

Change-Id: I91590665cd2d878b6b5ef92d1118610bb4a3fd84
(cherry picked from commit b9d90b5e81bcb27766bec04bb6f3794078506f82)

Power fault recovery: API implementation

This patch exposes fault field to the API node object,
microversion and compatibility is handled.

Story: #1596107
Task: #10469

Change-Id: I31ed332be12cf98baaf01badcbb09ae4b8c6cae9
Partial-Bug: #1596107

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-10 08:45:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix handling of netdevs with underscores

An underscore is used as a separator between the MAC and netdev
name when setting up udev rules for Ubuntu. This causes issues
if the netdev name itself has an underscore when the string is
split into multiple parts.

The solution is to split the string only on the first underscore,
since the MAC address is guaranteed not to have underscores.

Updated the unit test to match the scenario.

Change-Id: I32d68df56c733a748ad41c495fbb27f07ce36b38
Closes-Bug: 1722482
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of netdevs with underscores

An underscore is used as a separator between the MAC and netdev
name when setting up udev rules for Ubuntu. This causes issues
if the netdev name itself has an underscore when the string is
split into multiple parts.

The solution is to split the string only on the first underscore,
since the MAC address is guaranteed not to have underscores.

Updated the unit test to match the scenario.

Change-Id: I32d68df56c733a748ad41c495fbb27f07ce36b38
Closes-Bug: 1722482
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>

commit_message:
Update tests to use Juju storage

Due to changes to the ceph-osd charm, it is
suggested to use Juju storage for testing.

Change-Id: Ibdf6f4119001a4a07f9ddbc4fb2a9640860ff386
Related-Bug: #1698154

commit_message:
Update mission statement

When the mission statement was updated[1] in 2016, we failed to update
the Project Team Guide to match. This change keeps a citation of the
original statement for historic purposes.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20160217-mission-amendment.html

Change-Id: Iee6932cb8859391fadb3f20d59958ca5dbffd8d2

commit_message:
Make action descriptions terse, move to README.md

Output of `juju list-action` is at time of this writing
formatted in such a way that we should keep description
as terse as possible and refer to documentation elsewhere.

Change-Id: Ib8e7a4804e696199803b9ac386da7bf02aafd465

subject: Use subunit and stestr API more
messages:
[{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-10-05 10:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-10-05 10:58:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

this is more of a workaround than a real fix.

I tried to use the 'stestr load --subunit' but it fails with inside 'stestr' on accessing sys.stdout.buffer with

  AttributeError: file object has no attribute 'buffer'"'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-05 11:18:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-os-testr-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/52/509752/1/check/gate-os-testr-docs-ubuntu-xenial/9be1d17//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 4m 13s
- gate-os-testr-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/52/509752/1/check/gate-os-testr-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/ceba1c6/ : SUCCESS in 3m 58s
- gate-os-testr-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/52/509752/1/check/gate-os-testr-python27-ubuntu-xenial/71d641b/ : SUCCESS in 3m 12s
- gate-os-testr-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/52/509752/1/check/gate-os-testr-python35/e3b33a6/ : SUCCESS in 3m 49s'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2017-10-05 16:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2017-10-05 16:32:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

ok, sry I missed your comment, that looks like there is a bug when using stestr load from stdin. We don't actually need to shell out to call stestr we can use the python interface and pass it a file like object on the in_streams kwarg parameter for the subunit stream.

So for example L198 would become::

 commands.load(in_streams[sstdout], subunit_out=True)

(you might need a seek(0) on sstdout there)"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2017-10-05 18:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

fwiw, I pushed up a fix to stestr to fix the stdin support for stestr load: https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/pull/110

But, I still think we should avoid using a subprocess here.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-10-07 12:15:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

totally agree we could not be using subprocess here.

however I have some troubles with stestr's load API

with your example it fails with 

      _stream_spec = stream_spec[0]
  TypeError: '_io.BytesIO' object has no attribute '__getitem__'

and looking at stestr code I can't understand what's the expected structure of that "in_streams" argument. In docstring it says 'list of file objects..' but then later it is attempted to be unpacked as a list of tuples or other iterables [0]

any ideas?

[0] https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/blob/3ba921602cf4f9726d54e2c8a1b9452b72652af8/stestr/utils.py#L61-L63'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-10-07 12:37:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-07 12:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-10-07 12:38:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-10-07 12:42:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-10-07 12:42:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-07 12:46:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

commit_message:
Use subunit and stestr API more

avoid running subunit/subunit-trace/testr commands via
subprocess,
and instead use subunit and stestr Python API
when running ostestr with --pdb or --subunit

This also finally decouples ostestr from testr by not
actually relying on it any more.

Change-Id: I10fd7d1769651a54b74b4ffe7f23babc708dbd2a
Partial-Bug: #1721510

Power fault recovery: Notification objects

This patch exposes fault field for related notification objects.

Story: #1596107
Task: #10469

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 19:32:55.000000000', 'message': "Fluent-logging: Support creation of arbitrary number of templates

This updates the fluent-logging chart to support the creation of
an arbitrary number of templates for elasticsearch. This allows
for the definition of multiple index mappings driven via the
chart's values. This provides flexibility in determining specific
structures for indexes that may differ between log types.

This also moves to define these mappings via json instead of XML.
As gotpl can convert yaml directly to json, and elasticsearch can
ingest json directly for index creation, we no longer need an XML
helper function to generate the required configuration. This helps
reduce the number of helper functions we need to maintain

Change-Id: I3c85fb9a1e700eb1592d96f83e632172d0eb2681

an arbitrary number of templates for elasticsearch. This allows

This also moves to define these mappings via json instead of XML.

commit_message:
Fluent-logging: Support creation of arbitrary number of templates

This updates the fluent-logging chart to support the creation of
an arbitrary number of templates for elasticsearch. This allows
for the definition of multiple index mappings driven via the
chart's values. This provides flexibility in determining specific
structures for indexes that may differ between log types.

This also moves to define these mappings via json instead of XML.
As gotpl can convert yaml directly to json, and elasticsearch can
ingest json directly for index creation, we no longer need an XML
helper function to generate the required configuration. This helps
reduce the number of helper functions we need to maintain

Change-Id: I3c85fb9a1e700eb1592d96f83e632172d0eb2681

commit_message:
tasks: openstack_hosts_configure_dns: Fix dnf->yum symlink

Commit 0894c91063344d2b1a80d9e29a75be17981faaed ("Trivial: Fix the pep8
warning") added the usual '---' to yaml files but this broke the
dnf->yum symlink since it appeared like this:

openstack_hosts_configure_dnf.yml -> ---?openstack_hosts_configure_yum.yml

Change-Id: Ibbb2715115e9cdcf511a4b69ca692c9c89bd110d

Just updating the link to Pearson would be alternative?'}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2018-04-20 13:20:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> The IBM style guide was never freely available, we used the printed version ;) Before changing guides, we should discuss this.

Fair enough. Looks like I should start a thread on -dev to gather some more input. 

My take on this is that expecting developers who now write most of the content to obtain a printed style guide is not quite right. Providing them with an easy to access style guide based on the printed one from the same company looked like the way to go here.'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-04-26 05:09:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2018-04-27 12:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > some more input.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-05-02 16:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14947, 'date': '2018-05-18 09:12:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

Great idea, this guide is much shorter than the IMB Style Guide but also quite informative, and what is also important - freely available.'}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2018-06-04 15:38:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27781, 'date': '2018-06-04 15:43:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-06-04 17:21:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

While it would be nice if we could switch to recommending style guides which are in the public domain or published under a free (as in libre, not merely gratis) license, I understand the prudence of choosing one which doesn't imply a need to redo the style of our existing body of documentation. At least citing a style guide people can access is better than one they can't."}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-06-04 20:33:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

thx, let's merge"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-06-05 14:36:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

so do not depend on any external non-open-source style guides,
per the broader community feedback from:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130562.html

As for spelling references, refer to Merriam-Webster & IBM

Closes-Bug: #1764851
"}]
commit_message:
[contrib] Do not depend on non-free external style guides

The IBM Style Guide free version doesn't appear to be available,
so do not depend on any external non-open-source style guides,
per the broader community feedback from:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130562.html

As for spelling references, refer to Merriam-Webster & IBM
developerWorks (which is based on the formerly used IBM guide).

Change-Id: I722959870277d50020e6bac540522abf302ad23b
Closes-Bug: #1764851

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 10:16:55.000000000', 'message': "Break schedule_unhosted_gateways() into multiple DB transactions

When we're scheduling multiple gateway ports using the Least Loaded
policy (default), we need to take into account the actual load of
all chassis after each port is scheduled. Prior to this patch, the
scheduling happened under the same DB transaction so it will result
in scheduling all ports in the chassis which was less loaded by the time
the function was called, resulting in a very likely unbalanced state of
the gateway nodes.

NOTE: I'm working on bug 1762694 which will introduce functional
tests exercising this part.

Change-Id: I4404b0958d5a835a5ec449a6ff6696d6de6c78ef
Closes-Bug: 1763005
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-04-12 10:19:39.000000000', 'message': "Break schedule_unhosted_gateways() into multiple DB transactions

scheduling happened under the same DB transaction so it will result

NOTE: I'm working on bug 1762694 which will introduce functional

commit_message:
Break schedule_unhosted_gateways() into multiple DB transactions

When we're scheduling multiple gateway ports using the Least Loaded
policy (default), we need to take into account the actual load of
all chassis after each port is scheduled. Prior to this patch, the
scheduling happened under the same DB transaction so it will result
in scheduling all ports in the chassis which was less loaded by the time
the function was called, resulting in a very likely unbalanced state of
the gateway nodes.

NOTE: I'm working on bug 1762694 which will introduce functional
tests exercising this part.

Change-Id: I4404b0958d5a835a5ec449a6ff6696d6de6c78ef
Closes-Bug: 1763005
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry-picked from commit fab03e3f5d94a7d1708798460725a6ccdcdd36fe)

commit_message:
Switch to stestr in tox.ini

Change according the Project Testing Interface.

Also cap the version of cmd2 to <0.9.0: newer versions
require python 3.4. It looked like the bug should have been
fixed with 0.9.1 but it is not yet.

See https://github.com/python-cmd2/cmd2/issues/421

Change-Id: Iabb61b2f7991e28b990a9ed26b93af8dfb618b37

commit_message:
Pike to Queens controller upgrade guard rerun with no images

As discussed at [0] if current overcloud resources are removed
manually/some error, and even container images deleted, the
upgrade tasks should be able to guard.

We already have a similar guard for the fetch&retag at [1]

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1584809
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/8824e7abcde38b14236de0e4f172ac99852f62b4/docker/services/pacemaker/haproxy.yaml#L305-L324

Change-Id: I2c81e6d0f73fbef0f2a347b9fd4d27df91c2fdd1
(cherry picked from commit adb10e658653208483dc6ed9fd9c06d4cd72e2de)

commit_message:
Do not abort wait_for_provision_state of last_errors becomes non-empty

It can happen if one of heartbeats encounteres "node locked" error, which
is normal, because the next heartbeat will succeed.

Change-Id: Iaed9b83e199761eac4e0e2157c16ea1efa564c24
Story: #2002094
Task: #19772

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 17:06:58.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent "server migrate --wait" from hanging

Migrate uses the same mechanism in the backend than Resize and so the
steps and step names are similar. Currently when using the --wait
option with 'migrate', we wait forever because the status won't get to
active until the user performs an action. This makes it return on
verify_resize status just like 'resize' does, so that the user can
perform the next manual step.

Change-Id: Ie1aeac52506bc8801f88fd6a6eb4f6094cf20050
Story: 2001994
Task: 19621
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent "server migrate --wait" from hanging

Migrate uses the same mechanism in the backend than Resize and so the
steps and step names are similar. Currently when using the --wait
option with 'migrate', we wait forever because the status won't get to
active until the user performs an action. This makes it return on
verify_resize status just like 'resize' does, so that the user can
perform the next manual step.

Change-Id: Ie1aeac52506bc8801f88fd6a6eb4f6094cf20050
Story: 2001994
Task: 19621

commit_message:
NetApp: Fix to support SVM scoped permissions.

Improves NetApp cDOT block and file drivers suport for SVM scoped user
accounts. Features not supported for SVM scoped users include QoS,
aggregate usage reporting, and dedupe usage reporting.

Change-Id: I2b42622dbbb0f9f9f3eb9081cf67fb27e6c1a218
Closes-Bug: #1694579

commit_message:
Get deployment_stack_id via deployment_ref for config download

When the deployment is a software_resource, trying to get the
deployment_stack_id will failed with a http stack not found.
We need to get the deployment_stack_id with the dpeloyment
links.
Cherry pick from 8f7f5d2c6a62515e63dd2a11e61d2734ef31d1af

Closes-Bug: 1774961
Resolves: rhbz#1584951
Change-Id: I7f51a1d89ac6518d160b037615501dda745cb6e7

[{'created': '2018-06-05 06:02:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add options to improve beat to log stash performance

These options allow any beat to override the assumed index.

When writing to logstash additional compression will be used by default.

pipelining has been enabled to improve write performance and a single
worker will be used per logstash host.

Change-Id: I71a256160cfa08d481959f8d6fc7183740f05c8d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add options to improve beat to log stash performance

These options allow any beat to override the assumed index.

When writing to logstash additional compression will be used by default.

pipelining has been enabled to improve write performance and a single
worker will be used per logstash host.

Change-Id: I71a256160cfa08d481959f8d6fc7183740f05c8d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add NTP commands and missing steps to the UC backup/restore

OpenStack services are time sensitive
we need to be sure nodes are synchronized
correctly before running any backup/restore
task.

Also added some commands fixes for missing steps.

Change-Id: Ie013bb85c39e9a16b8ef46e446617148332d2488

The value maps to the CinderNetappNfsMountOptions THT parameter.

messages:
[{'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-02-13 21:45:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-02-13 21:46:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Should I have generated a new Change-Id for the backport?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-04 23:06:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think we need to backport updates like this every time a new image is made available."}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-06-05 11:36:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ok, so not unless the image disappears from the download site would we want such backports?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-05 12:08:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Even then it's questionable, but I suppose we could do that while the given release is in the regular "Maintained" stable period and not "Extended Maintenance". At some point legacy documentation just needs to be left as is.

All that said, I suppose Queens is the current newest release out there, so I suppose since the risk level is so low, we might as well keep latest documentation updated. Let's just do this. Thanks for bearing with me - this is kind of an unusual one that I don't know if we really had considered before.'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-31 00:39:36.000000000', 'message': "Refactor object updater's async-pending finder

Pulled the FS walking out into its own function so that finding
async_pendings is in one place and processing them is in another. This
should make it easier to add greenthread-based concurrency later.

Also refactored rate limiting to use utils.RateLimitedIterator instead
of calling ratelimit_sleep ourselves. The functionality's the same,
but the interface is easier.

Change-Id: I02f9e3201e9434080c6fb87ac5e249d8b327a231
"}, {'created': '2018-06-05 00:14:43.000000000', 'message': "Refactor object updater's async-pending finder

Pulled the FS walking out into its own function so that finding
async_pendings is in one place and processing them is in another. This
should make it easier to add greenthread-based concurrency later.

Also refactored rate limiting to use utils.RateLimitedIterator instead
of calling ratelimit_sleep ourselves. The functionality's the same,
but the interface is easier.

Change-Id: I02f9e3201e9434080c6fb87ac5e249d8b327a231
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor object updater's async-pending finder

Pulled the FS walking out into its own function so that finding
async_pendings is in one place and processing them is in another. This
should make it easier to add greenthread-based concurrency later.

Also refactored rate limiting to use utils.RateLimitedIterator instead
of calling ratelimit_sleep ourselves. The functionality's the same,
but the interface is easier.

Change-Id: I02f9e3201e9434080c6fb87ac5e249d8b327a231

commit_message:
Bypass pip constraints when installing Elastic Curator

The elasticsearch-curator package requires certifi 2018.4.16 but this
is constrained to version 2018.1.18. Use isolated mode to allow
installation of the upstream version.

Change-Id: I6e4336d912f3f6bab557cb0401d8a89ccad8a3d8

[{'created': '2018-06-05 10:01:47.000000000', 'message': 'Evaluators to receive updates of actions executed during init

During init evaluator workers will not receive evaluator
actions (aka new alarm/states/etc..) as the queues are
read before the processor graph calls subscribe. hence
their graph may not be in sync

Change-Id: Ic5b2c3626c537300769676e7ccd981109dad566d
'}]
commit_message:
Evaluators to receive updates of actions executed during init

During init evaluator workers will not receive evaluator
actions (aka new alarm/states/etc..) as the queues are
read before the processor graph calls subscribe. hence
their graph may not be in sync

Change-Id: Ic5b2c3626c537300769676e7ccd981109dad566d

messages:
[{'account_id': 28387, 'date': '2018-06-04 11:39:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-04 11:39:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28387, 'date': '2018-06-04 11:43:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-06-05 01:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9820, 'date': '2018-06-05 01:45:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-06-05 06:42:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-06-05 11:07:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-04 11:39:11.000000000', 'message': 'modify the kuryr workflow document

In the document, it shows that when user input commands like "sudo docker run --net=foo -itd --name=container1 busybox", '/IpamDriver.RequestAddress' will get a POST call which the 'options' is empty, just like this:
{
    "Address": "",
    "PoolID": "941f790073c3a2c70099ea527ee3a6205e037e84749f2c6e8a5287d9c62fd376",
    "Options": {},
}
but I have checked the workflow, and I found it's not true. The Options

commit_message:
modify the kuryr workflow document

In the document, it shows that when user input commands like "sudo docker run --net=foo -itd --name=container1 busybox", '/IpamDriver.RequestAddress' will get a POST call which the 'options' is empty, just like this:
{
    "Address": "",
    "PoolID": "941f790073c3a2c70099ea527ee3a6205e037e84749f2c6e8a5287d9c62fd376",
    "Options": {},
}
but I have checked the workflow, and I found it's not true. The Options
will be non-empty, and it will be like "com.docker.network.endpoint.macaddress": "08:22:e0:a8:7d:db".
Fixes: Bug 1774977

Change-Id: Ia4632fb376471893de71b57b49ca0241cf0f60c2

commit_message:
Disable security group rule when create port

Use "driver_handles_share_servers=True" backend driver.
When create service neutron port to connect with service instances,
we should set the port security group is disable, to prevent be added
the default security group in neutron. Because some cases the default
security group would lead to the port can not connect with the service
instances.

Change-Id: Ib13e4f80c5a54b2b863b511ebb6e8f82700a3639
Closes-Bug:#1720283
(cherry picked from commit 3c3d899837e256d4692c4195f0e77ff600817e5c)

commit_message:
Use HMAC.hexdigest to avoid non-ascii characters for package data

hmac.compare_digest() method in python 3 doesn't suppport non-ASCII
characters, so that we need to use HMAC.hexdigest() to avoid non-ASCII
bytes.

For backward compability, we still need to support HMAC created by
using HMAC.digest() in the old amphorae.

Change-Id: I1061e855d0ce06d91a26d217291008197e4a708b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567688/
Story: 2002125
Task: 19807

commit_message:
tox: Use default Python 3 version, remove pypy

When running tests locally, use only default Python version 3 so
that when Python version is updated, this will use the latest py3.

Remove pypy environment as this implementation is not being
used.

This does not affect Zuul configuration, only developer's local.

Change-Id: I9eb0834f3d39f33b05ab638a744d798f1eda0e08

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: volume_type_encryption

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below volume type
encryption API's:
* POST /v3/{project_id}/types/{volume_type_id}/encryption
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/types/{volume_type_id}/encryption/{encryption_id}

Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

Change-Id: I6488cc89e60a31605ddf80c7aa56ddf4871d3c1a

commit_message:
Add shared functions to configure ceph repositories

The functions support only repositories from shaman,
but they can be extended to support stable repositories as well.

Change-Id: I633f80c0f74a69e6d67674398f2013f09b96c661

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 19:58:27.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup CentOS/Fedora support

Clean the "CentOS" branch, so that it should work for all
CentOS/RHEL variants (7.x). Make sure to install the
required repositories also in the non-Manila case.

Fedora already ships Ceph packages so does not need additional
repositories.

Do not try to install ceph-radosgw twice.

Finally, explicitly fail for other distributions (not supported
de-facto even in the current code).

Change-Id: I83b1fffad405bc122bc55ef1173f5239f41d2b36
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup CentOS/Fedora support

Clean the "CentOS" branch, so that it should work for all
CentOS/RHEL variants (7.x). Make sure to install the
required repositories also in the non-Manila case.

Fedora already ships Ceph packages so does not need additional
repositories.

Do not try to install ceph-radosgw twice.

Finally, explicitly fail for other distributions (not supported
de-facto even in the current code).

Change-Id: I83b1fffad405bc122bc55ef1173f5239f41d2b36

'}, {'created': '2017-12-07 14:29:55.000000000', 'message': 'Enable inspector dnsmasq dhcp filter

Modify both the inspector and dnsmasq containers for the inspector to be
able to modify dnsmasq configuration on the fly to filter the dhcp
traffic.

commit_message:
Enable inspector dnsmasq dhcp filter

Modify both the inspector and dnsmasq containers for the inspector to be
able to modify dnsmasq configuration on the fly to filter the dhcp
traffic.

The upgrade_tasks moved to the puppet service in order to be shared
between both the containerised and regular deployment.  The upgrade_tasks
were amended with steps to clean-up the iptables inspector chain&rules.

With inspector no longer managing iptables rules, create new rules to
allow DHCP traffic on IronicInspectorInterface.

Co-Authored-By: Harald Jensås <hjensas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic7e32acb8559a7a12cd8767dc68c343872a6a4e3
Depends-On: I056cdadc025f35d8b6fd22f510a7c0a8e259a1f0

subject: Show WEBSSO disclaimer only when it is needed
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-05 10:58:52.000000000', 'message': 'Show WEBSSO disclaimer only when it is needed

Horizon can support several auth mechanisms, i.e. Keystone creds and
OpenID. User allowed to choose proper way of auth and disclaimer is
shown. But it is possible to allow choose from the only variant, and in
this case disclaimer also shown, which is confusing. Proposed patch fix
disclaimer display and makes it reasonable

Change-Id: I4bba535c5700179dcfa02dfe774c82bf7ec70824
Related-issue: PROD-20214
'}]
commit_message:
Show WEBSSO disclaimer only when it is needed

Horizon can support several auth mechanisms, i.e. Keystone creds and
OpenID. User allowed to choose proper way of auth and disclaimer is
shown. But it is possible to allow choose from the only variant, and in
this case disclaimer also shown, which is confusing. Proposed patch fix
disclaimer display and makes it reasonable

Change-Id: I4bba535c5700179dcfa02dfe774c82bf7ec70824
Related-issue: PROD-20214

messages: [{'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-06-05 09:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-06-05 09:51:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-06-05 10:37:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-05 09:51:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix fail_if_empty

* Since the wrapped command contains pipe bash doesn't toss full command to
fail_if_empty as $@. To avoid this behavior this patch explicitly adds '' so $@
contains the proper commands.
* Additionally this patch adds tonumber to first invocation

Change-Id: I958e14c0a4ea4b5782d2c74dc895471b0f70b875
"}]
commit_message:
Fix fail_if_empty

* Since the wrapped command contains pipe bash doesn't toss full command to
fail_if_empty as $@. To avoid this behavior this patch explicitly adds '' so $@
contains the proper commands.
* Additionally this patch adds tonumber to first invocation

Change-Id: I958e14c0a4ea4b5782d2c74dc895471b0f70b875

commit_message:
Fix Dockerfile for Debian Jessie

As we learned in I488445dfd261b7bca322a0be7b4d8ca6105750a3
that the the docker file needed to change, this is a targeted
change to address the docker file contents and not update
the coreos version that is built.

This is being done to fix the stable branch builds.

Change-Id: I7251dc7deac788716adad7b596f25fd1633cf289

When implementing OVN driver octavia, I am facing the same issues. This will be really helpful.

Thanks.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-31 12:02:13.000000000', 'message': "Providers: propose changes to API

While implementing an API driver for VMware loadbalancing platforms,
we ran into several difficulties which, I believe, might impact other
vendors as well.

The current approach of passing only the object id in delete operation
forces the driver to either run within Octavia's context, or maintain
a full state in order to map a sub-object id (e.g listener), to a
loadbalancer, which it should be deleted from.

With updates the problem is more complex as for reference the driver
has to maintain a full state of the object - not only mapping to the
loadbalancer. We already know what maintaining a mirror state is painful
as we experienced this for a while with LBaaSv2 and Octavia.
As an alternative, the driver could retreive the properties from the
appliance which may be a costly operation and will only resolve the update
challenges.

Change-Id: Ide4beaf73bb99be5c3b4c71c12fecef3499f45d9
"}, {'created': '2018-05-31 20:22:44.000000000', 'message': "Providers: propose changes to API

While implementing an API driver for VMware loadbalancing platforms,
we ran into several difficulties which, I believe, might impact other
vendors as well.

The current approach of passing only the object id in delete operation
forces the driver to either run within Octavia's context, or maintain
a full state in order to map a sub-object id (e.g listener), to a
loadbalancer, which it should be deleted from.

With updates the problem is more complex as for reference the driver
has to maintain a full state of the object - not only mapping to the
loadbalancer. We already know what maintaining a mirror state is painful
as we experienced this for a while with LBaaSv2 and Octavia.
As an alternative, the driver could retreive the properties from the
appliance which may be a costly operation and will only resolve the update
challenges.

Change-Id: Ide4beaf73bb99be5c3b4c71c12fecef3499f45d9
"}, {'created': '2018-06-03 12:16:52.000000000', 'message': "Providers: propose changes to API

With updates the problem is more complex as for reference the driver

As an alternative, the driver could retreive the properties from the

Change-Id: Ide4beaf73bb99be5c3b4c71c12fecef3499f45d9

we ran into several difficulties which, I believe, might impact other
vendors as well.

The current approach of passing only the object id in delete operation
forces the driver to either run within Octavia's context, or maintain
a full state in order to map a sub-object id (e.g listener), to a
loadbalancer, which it should be deleted from.

With updates the problem is more complex as for reference the driver
has to maintain a full state of the object - not only mapping to the
loadbalancer. We already know what maintaining a mirror state is painful
as we experienced this for a while with LBaaSv2 and Octavia.
As an alternative, the driver could retreive the properties from the
appliance which may be a costly operation and will only resolve the update
challenges.

Change-Id: Ide4beaf73bb99be5c3b4c71c12fecef3499f45d9

commit_message:
Providers: propose changes to API

While implementing an API driver for VMware loadbalancing platforms,
we ran into several difficulties which, I believe, might impact other
vendors as well.

The current approach of passing only the object id in delete operation
forces the driver to either run within Octavia's context, or maintain
a full state in order to map a sub-object id (e.g listener), to a
loadbalancer, which it should be deleted from.

With updates the problem is more complex as for reference the driver
has to maintain a full state of the object - not only mapping to the
loadbalancer. We already know what maintaining a mirror state is painful
as we experienced this for a while with LBaaSv2 and Octavia.
As an alternative, the driver could retreive the properties from the
appliance which may be a costly operation and will only resolve the update
challenges.

Change-Id: Ide4beaf73bb99be5c3b4c71c12fecef3499f45d9

commit_message:
Implement provider drivers - Cleanup

This patch addresses the following:
Fixes some unit tests.
Cleans up some code from the parent patches,
Adds a release note for the provider driver support.
Adds the "List providers" API.
Adds a document listing the know provider drivers.
Adds a provider driver development guide.

Change-Id: I90dc39e5e9d7d5839913dc2dbf187d935ee2b8b5
Story: 1655768
Task: 5165

commit_message:
Make final stats dump after reconstructor runs once

When running in multiprocess mode, the object reconstructor would
periodically aggregate its workers' recon data into a single recon
measurement. However, at the end of the run, all that was left in
recon was the last periodic measurement; any work that took place
after that point was not recored in the aggregate. However, it was
recorded in the per-disk stats that the worker processes emitted.

This commit adds a final recon aggregation after the worker processes
have finished.

Change-Id: Ia6a3a931e9e7a23824765b2ab111a5492e509be8

commit_message:
cadvisor: add debian/aarch64 support

Use Debian package from unstable on Debian/aarch64. It works in
stretch-backports container fine and saves us from backporting huge pile
of Golang packages.

Change-Id: Ib4dd540446c58ee69bb46b36f5d7968910943e38

commit_message:
Fixed two issues regarding cookiecutter template

- cookiecutter.json was using single quotes which is not JSON valid
- there was a typo in CONTRIBUTING.rst:
   "cookiebutter" instead of "cookiecutter"

Change-Id: I102b31b8152d2c9f2af8bbd3fca555eae50b3b42

commit_message:
Fix FakeBIOS to allow tempest testing

In order to start tempest testing using FakeBIOS, we
need to fix some issues, like enabling it on the fake
driver, and add the clean_steps decorators.

Change-Id: I7c47187b823c3a0ce1784849d401bd6baafe2542

commit_message:
Don't hardcode OC user name for various checks.

During oc upgrade we check if UC is configured with SSL, and
if yes - check that OC nodes can access it.
The user we have is hardcoded to 'heat-admin' which doesn't work
for pre-provisioned scenarios.

Change-Id: I9e22373a7be48e707b393023cac24ece94546228

commit_message:
Fix listener update race with default pool removal

If the listener-api code updates the DB before the controller-worker
code for the update executes (this seems very common) and the update is
removing a default pool, then the pool is already gone from the object
before we get to that point in the amp-driver.

Change-Id: If06141ef2328608c019594852a3ded3872b8a51d

commit_message:
Support listing availability zones

Zun has introduced an API endpoint for listing availability zones
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/564670/). This patch is the client
side implementation. In particular, this patch does the following:
* Python API for listing availability zones
* A CLI command for listing availability zones
  (i.e. zun availability-zone-list)
* An OSC command for doing the same
  (i.e. openstack appcontainer availability zone list)

Related-Bug: #1766395
Change-Id: I6c0512816277a63bbf444d0775121bb5d964a36a

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

Also clean up requirements.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ic9317d0d2e71ffcc5012184510b554453a7e322f
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

parsed such that object names are always limited to 256 chars. This
patch ensures that the expected criteria is met.

Closes-Bug: 1775029

commit_message:
Fix osd object name restriction

The list of devices provided to the charm is currently incorrectly
parsed such that object names are always limited to 256 chars. This
patch ensures that the expected criteria is met.

Change-Id: Ic5b25af614c77b35484b12dc654df5ac595d9d80
Closes-Bug: 1775029

Nose and Django test runners without addidional configuration.

commit_message:
Rename test files to test_* pattern

We're going to switch to default Django test runner by default.
This patch renames test files to make tests descoverable by
Nose and Django test runners without addidional configuration.

This patch alse removes executable flag from test/helpers.py.

Related blueprint: improve-horizon-testing

Change-Id: I495a2ec583ca9ae1df442059ffa9e4abc94d3528

Nose and Django test runners without addidional configuration.

commit_message:
storage: hide useless logs

Logging the sqlalchemy DuplicateEntry error message on each event
is useless. And people may though it's an error.

This change moves the log level to debug.

Change-Id: I86b64e5cf370386dab6f962b09029feeb35a9dbf

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated in Queens [1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 22:52:07.000000000', 'message': "Disallow SSLv2, SSLv3 and TLS1.0 in rabbitmq for FedRAMP compliance

Only allow TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 when connecting to the AMQP port over SSL.

We cannot disable a specific protocol version for inter node communication,
so in order to enforce TLS1.1 or greater, we disallow all ciphers provided
by SSLv2 SSLv3 and TLS1.0.

Node: The list of allowed ciphers cannot be specified with the usual
OpenSSL cipher list format, so we pass the list of ciphers which are
available out of the default cipher list [1] used for other services like
HAProxy, stunnel or mysql/galera. The list is precomputed with:

openssl ciphers -v {cipher_list_format} | cut -d' ' -f 1 | paste -sd :

[1] !SSLv2:kEECDH:kRSA:kEDH:kPSK:+3DES:!aNULL:!eNULL:!MD5:!EXP:!RC4:!SEED:!IDEA:!DES:!SSLv3:!TLSv1

Change-Id: I354d5851345033a90b43e6be9a6039cb4edca203
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>

commit_message:
Disallow SSLv2, SSLv3 and TLS1.0 in rabbitmq for FedRAMP compliance

Only allow TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 when connecting to the AMQP port over SSL.

We cannot disable a specific protocol version for inter node communication,
so in order to enforce TLS1.1 or greater, we disallow all ciphers provided
by SSLv2 SSLv3 and TLS1.0.

Node: The list of allowed ciphers cannot be specified with the usual
OpenSSL cipher list format, so we pass the list of ciphers which are
available out of the default cipher list [1] used for other services like
HAProxy, stunnel or mysql/galera. The list is precomputed with:

openssl ciphers -v {cipher_list_format} | cut -d' ' -f 1 | paste -sd :

[1] !SSLv2:kEECDH:kRSA:kEDH:kPSK:+3DES:!aNULL:!eNULL:!MD5:!EXP:!RC4:!SEED:!IDEA:!DES:!SSLv3:!TLSv1

Change-Id: I354d5851345033a90b43e6be9a6039cb4edca203
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>

commit_message:
Use pip_check_reqs module

pip_missing_reqs has some bugs and is renamed(see [1])
to pip_check_reqs since v2.0. Switch to pip_check_reqs
module to get the bug fixes and updates.

[1] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pip_check_reqs/2.0

Change-Id: Ic562975a82861d4e7cf322a982a60e0c6041ad44

commit_message:
Devicemapper storage driver need specified volume

For the 'devicemapper' storage driver, must specify volume and
the minimum value is 3GB.

Change-Id: I2b5ab83ac00b4a5bc6f113924e022f8952dd7766
Closes-Bug: #1772782

subject: Move database creation into role (horizon)
messages:
[{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-06-01 14:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-01 21:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-04 01:25:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-06-04 14:21:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-05 04:00:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 14:55:57.000000000', 'message': 'Move database creation into role (horizon)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the test-vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

commit_message:
Move database creation into role (horizon)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the test-vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: I5387011d12bc4f61f6dfa08f86bbf7cc9378022d
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571755

[{'created': '2018-05-14 21:17:13.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Report the virtual size of RAW disks

If642e51a4e186833349a8e30b04224a3687f5594 started to correctly report
the actual size of preallocated file based disks but missed that this
value was later used as the virtual disk size for RAW disks.

This is an issue as nova.virt.libvirt.utils.create_image creates these
disks as sparse files with a reported actual size much smaller than the
virtual size. During block based LM this then results in disks
on the destination being created with a much smaller virtual size than
the disk should have leading to errors during the transfer.

      nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

commit_message:
libvirt: Report the virtual size of RAW disks

If642e51a4e186833349a8e30b04224a3687f5594 started to correctly report
the actual size of preallocated file based disks but missed that this
value was later used as the virtual disk size for RAW disks.

This is an issue as nova.virt.libvirt.utils.create_image creates these
disks as sparse files with a reported actual size much smaller than the
virtual size. During block based LM this then results in disks
on the destination being created with a much smaller virtual size than
the disk should have leading to errors during the transfer.

Conflicts:
      nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I9616a602ee0605f7f1dc1f47b6416f01895e025b in Ocata.

Closes-Bug: #1770640
Change-Id: I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56
(cherry picked from commit 016986f4706e881fed16c85c8790af4d26a7c351)
(cherry picked from commit 2dc9795a0df40c51ef3c79f99e57725db99019c0)
(cherry picked from commit 938c0a745325fa73d098c6d5ddd20b2a599f9624)

commit_message:
Move database creation into role (neutron)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the test-vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: I0c40e3b9493e8c5b2c1009a9aae8fe78e963c074
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571781

commit_message:
Move database creation into role (heat)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the test-vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: Ifc869c4940b22ebce233ead7a8993f30f8328bcd
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571741

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I9caa2fa24eddbf20fa2dba48260cfa9d5b039ec4

subject: Fix module has no attribute 'parse_args'
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-31 01:06:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix module has no attribute 'parse_args'

Change: I469d4b6df49ad3489722feae0b795c20a6a3913b has added support
of deploying masakari with uwsgi. In this change the import in
masakari/cmd/api.py module is changed from *from masakari import
config* to *from masakari import config as api_config* but the
respective occurence of its use is not replaced with the new
module name i.e., api_config.

This patch fixes this issue by correcting the module name from
*config* to *api_config*.

Change-Id: Ib385a3599f2aafe5092f714fd5b761051c099069
Closes-Bug: #1774300
"}]
commit_message:
Fix module has no attribute 'parse_args'

Change: I469d4b6df49ad3489722feae0b795c20a6a3913b has added support
of deploying masakari with uwsgi. In this change the import in
masakari/cmd/api.py module is changed from *from masakari import
config* to *from masakari import config as api_config* but the
respective occurence of its use is not replaced with the new
module name i.e., api_config.

This patch fixes this issue by correcting the module name from
*config* to *api_config*.

Change-Id: Ib385a3599f2aafe5092f714fd5b761051c099069
Closes-Bug: #1774300

commit_message:
Add rabbit driver ssl config option

The driver option is necessary as the transport_url query param
override requires the value. Default will be to use the oslomsg
rpc setting.

Change-Id: Ia3417beb195aabb10dcb24072834cb10f2827931

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install

Install the dependencies explicitly in requirements instead of using
tox_install which does not work well with OpenStack CI.

Adapt tox.ini for this.

This commit includes the following unrelated change to pass
the gate.
----------------------------------------
gate_hook: Remove neutron repo from the list of tempest plugins

The code has been moved to neutron-tempest-plugins.

Closes-Bug: #1769904
Change-Id: I1213f4c9947248ae61b9954fec22f77fc6bb5d2d
----------------------------------------

Co-Authored-By: YAMAMOTO Takashi <yamamoto@midokura.com>
Change-Id: Iff427bbf9b659076e3bfecdd5e0bff9553db9dec
(cherry picked from commit 088befedd60c7de7ec980adb92b3082a002c8ad7)

lgtm, thx'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-05-30 09:57:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-06-05 02:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-06-05 02:41:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Frank and Kaka,
Thanks for your reviews.
I've just uploaded a new patch to resolve conflict caused by [1]
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571379/"}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-06-05 03:28:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I would advise against changing the port number here.

This OSSN report is documenting a security flaw for past versions of keystone when the v2.0 API is still present[0] and used 35357 for the admin port. It's true that from Queens onward, services should only use 5000 for keystone as the v2.0 API was removed, but for this document keep the 35357 here for historical accuracy.

[0] (and more widely used before users started migrating fully to v3)"}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-06-05 03:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Hi Gage Hugo,
Thanks for your comment.
This change will be abandoned then.'}]

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for Keystone endpoint

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for Keystone endpoint.

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: Id83e5ae456753d5882e2d6007054a3a1f7fe2a4c

commit_message:
Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_deleting_project_also_invalidates_tokens

The `test_deleting_project_also_invalidated_tokens` was incorrectly
routing to the server and generating a 404 due to no route to a
controller. This fix properly prepends /v3 by using .get instead of
.admin_request.

Change-Id: I4f46f1c2cac416a9052bfcbbc0084d64a9564fad

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-02 02:14:20.000000000', 'message': "Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_change_user_password_also_deletes_tokens

The `test_change_user_password_also_deletes_tokens` test was not
utilizing .get and therefore was not getting the '/v3' prepended to
the /auth/tokens request path. This resulted in an erroneous 404
response from the server (in flask this generates as an text/html
404 instead of an application handled application/json 404). This
test would always succeed in the last step as the token was not
actually validated. The 404 response was generated due to the
lack of routing instead of the lack of a valid token.

Change-Id: I850efdbc20281e454828e40664b58a28036f79dd
"}]
commit_message:
Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_change_user_password_also_deletes_tokens

The `test_change_user_password_also_deletes_tokens` test was not
utilizing .get and therefore was not getting the '/v3' prepended to
the /auth/tokens request path. This resulted in an erroneous 404
response from the server (in flask this generates as an text/html
404 instead of an application handled application/json 404). This
test would always succeed in the last step as the token was not
actually validated. The 404 response was generated due to the
lack of routing instead of the lack of a valid token.

Change-Id: I850efdbc20281e454828e40664b58a28036f79dd

commit_message:
Get deployment_stack_id via deployment_ref for config download

When the deployment is a software_resource, trying to get the
deployment_stack_id will failed with a http stack not found.
We need to get the deployment_stack_id with the dpeloyment
links.

Closes-Bug: 1774961
Resolves: rhbz#1584951
Change-Id: I7f51a1d89ac6518d160b037615501dda745cb6e7

commit_message:
Merge values for same key from multiple services

This should merge multiple and different values for the same key
found in different services.

For example, assuming two services defining a key as follows:

  config_settings:
    mykey:
    - val1

  config_settings:
    mykey:
    - val2
    - val3

the content of the key, as seen by ansible or puppet on the nodes,
will be:

  mykey: ['val1','val2','val3']

Change-Id: I190374e36ad1a2b57611a3a9d0a52ceb1a049aff

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 13:11:56.000000000', 'message': "Make ipmi lanplus the default in auto fencing

This commit sets the default value for the lanplus parameter
(--ipmi-lanplus) to true instead of the previous false.
This is the default used by all modern IPMI interfaces so there's no
meaning to keep the default to false, and in any case the override will
still be possible.

Change-Id: Ic206c235f040f03d0d0334bf396864d3eeb400d2

commit_message:
Make ipmi lanplus the default in auto fencing

This commit sets the default value for the lanplus parameter,
--ipmi-lanplus, to true instead of the previous false.
This is the default used by all modern IPMI interfaces so there's no
meaning to keep the default to false, and in any case the override will
still be possible, by specifying --ipmi-no-lanplus.

Change-Id: Ic206c235f040f03d0d0334bf396864d3eeb400d2

'}, {'created': '2017-06-23 19:46:45.000000000', 'message': "Make If-None-Match:* work properly with 0-byte PUTs

When PUTting an object with `If-None-Match: *`, we rely 100-continue
support: the proxy checks the responses from all object-servers, and if
any of them respond 412, it closes down the connections. When there's
actual data for the object, this ensures that even nodes that *don't*
respond 412 will hit a ChunkReadTimeout and abort the PUT.

However, if the client does a PUT with a Content-Length of 0, that would
get sent all the way to the object server, which had all the information
it needed to respond 201. After replication, the PUT propagates to the
other nodes and the old object is lost, despite the client receiving a
412 indicating the operation failed.

Now, when PUTting a zero-byte object, switch to a chunked transfer so
the object-server still gets a ChunkReadTimeout.

Change-Id: Ie88e41aca2d59246c3134d743c1531c8e996f9e4
"}, {'created': '2017-06-23 22:50:06.000000000', 'message': "Make If-None-Match:* work properly with 0-byte PUTs

commit_message:
Make If-None-Match:* work properly with 0-byte PUTs

When PUTting an object with `If-None-Match: *`, we rely 100-continue
support: the proxy checks the responses from all object-servers, and if
any of them respond 412, it closes down the connections. When there's
actual data for the object, this ensures that even nodes that *don't*
respond 412 will hit a ChunkReadTimeout and abort the PUT.

However, if the client does a PUT with a Content-Length of 0, that would
get sent all the way to the object server, which had all the information
it needed to respond 201. After replication, the PUT propagates to the
other nodes and the old object is lost, despite the client receiving a
412 indicating the operation failed.

Now, when PUTting a zero-byte object, switch to a chunked transfer so
the object-server still gets a ChunkReadTimeout.

Change-Id: Ie88e41aca2d59246c3134d743c1531c8e996f9e4

commit_message:
Require the (soon-to-be) Rocky version of Horizon

... or at least the first published tarball which will lead to Rocky.
On the other side this means forcing the usage of mox as long as
there are tests that depends on it (the switch was already flipped
in Horizon, so it needs to be enabled here).

This allows us to depend on newer Horizon features, including changes
to the test suite that are useful for the mox removal effort.

Change-Id: Ibf41998cb154c5170e8038f5b2708c928b68b8b4
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>
Story: #2002037
Task: #19678

commit_message:
Remove share_backend_name from Dell-EMC manila backends

This parameter has a default value from puppet-manila
ex: [1], and doesn't need to be specified here.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-manila/tree/manifests/backend/dellemc_unity.pp

Change-Id: I7fa8ffd9af459f138bc182fd6bd307471c87f75d
Closes-Bug: #1771656

subject: Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation
messages:
[{'account_id': 27565, 'date': '2018-05-02 07:52:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-08 00:33:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Editing old release notes causes the modified release note to show up in again in the latest release.

Is that really worthwhile for a change that renders exactly the same in the output? (Always the "Chinese" way incidentally, since this is nothing whatsoever to do with Chinese vs. English punctuation, or Chinese input methods, regardless of what the commit message you copied this from said.)'}, {'account_id': 27565, 'date': '2018-06-05 02:19:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 07:52:46.000000000', 'message': 'Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: I0d0b10dcfd2ebb193822befbf6da406402d053ee
'}]
commit_message:
Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-17 21:39:08.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp ONTAP: Set new sub-lun clone limit for ONTAP driver

Until ONTAP v8.3, the driver used to perform sub-lun clone of up to 64GB
per operation, but as of v9.1, ONTAP handles only 128MB per operation.
This new limit is causing error on volume extending operations, which
triggers sub-lun cloning when resizing exceeds max-resize-geometry.
For instance, if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, the operation
fails because it triggers a single sub-lun cloning of 1GB.

This fix sets the limit used by sub-lun cloning to 128MB, therefore
if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, it no longer fails, and
instead it will trigger 8 sub-lun cloning operations of 128MB.

Change-Id: Ib294cbdbdfe19d34a7702dafec2c8d29136a2f25
Closes-Bug: #1762424
(cherry picked from commit 029cadbf4067ad6f0bf08588cf439587f3c7052c)
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Set new sub-lun clone limit for ONTAP driver

Until ONTAP v8.3, the driver used to perform sub-lun clone of up to 64GB
per operation, but as of v9.1, ONTAP handles only 128MB per operation.
This new limit is causing error on volume extending operations, which
triggers sub-lun cloning when resizing exceeds max-resize-geometry.
For instance, if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, the operation
fails because it triggers a single sub-lun cloning of 1GB.

This fix sets the limit used by sub-lun cloning to 128MB, therefore
if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, it no longer fails, and
instead it will trigger 8 sub-lun cloning operations of 128MB.

Change-Id: Ib294cbdbdfe19d34a7702dafec2c8d29136a2f25
Closes-Bug: #1762424
(cherry picked from commit 029cadbf4067ad6f0bf08588cf439587f3c7052c)

APIs response.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 19:22:42.000000000', 'message': "Decouple bootstrap from cli module

We have a cli command that's useful for bootstrapping new
deployments, resetting administrator passwords, creating the default
domain, et cetera. But this functionality isn't just useful for
operators. We could actually benefit from using the same process
in our tests.

Many test cases actually do a bunch of their own setup. Sometimes
they duplicate a lot of what bootstrap already provides. Other times
test modules just blindly inherit from ``core.TestCase`` to get
things works. This isn't ideal because it isn't DRY. It also becomes
really easy to tack on extra cycles to each test when things are
added to the generic ``load_fixtures`` method that is typically run
for each test.

Instead, we can try and reuse what we give to operators for our
testing. This will:

  - Reduce duplicate setup scenarios across test modules
  - Reduce extra resource creation and cleanup when it's not needed
    for a particular set of test
  - Enforces better readability if each test case assumes the same
    basic structure of data present after bootstrap, test classes
    that need addition resources should include those in their
    setUp or setUpClass methods
  - We engrain the testing of a tool we provide to operators into
    our testing environment

This commit helps us move in that direction by encapsulating the
logic for bootstrapping deployments into a reusable object that is
accessible by both the tests and the cli tooling.

Change-Id: I84c75076405e6af9356f79778f2d2e67855f4fe0
"}, {'created': '2018-04-05 04:07:37.000000000', 'message': "Decouple bootstrap from cli module

We have a cli command that's useful for bootstrapping new
deployments, resetting administrator passwords, creating the default
domain, et cetera. But this functionality isn't just useful for
operators. We could actually benefit from using the same process
in our tests.

Many test cases actually do a bunch of their own setup. Sometimes
they duplicate a lot of what bootstrap already provides. Other times
test modules just blindly inherit from ``core.TestCase`` to get
things works. This isn't ideal because it isn't DRY. It also becomes
really easy to tack on extra cycles to each test when things are
added to the generic ``load_fixtures`` method that is typically run
for each test.

Instead, we can try and reuse what we give to operators for our
testing. This will:

  - Reduce duplicate setup scenarios across test modules
  - Reduce extra resource creation and cleanup when it's not needed

    basic structure of data present after bootstrap, test classes
    that need addition resources should include those in their
    setUp or setUpClass methods
  - We engrain the testing of a tool we provide to operators into
    our testing environment

This commit helps us move in that direction by encapsulating the
logic for bootstrapping deployments into a reusable object that is
accessible by both the tests and the cli tooling.

Change-Id: I84c75076405e6af9356f79778f2d2e67855f4fe0

commit_message:
Decouple bootstrap from cli module

We have a cli command that's useful for bootstrapping new
deployments, resetting administrator passwords, creating the default
domain, et cetera. But this functionality isn't just useful for
operators. We could actually benefit from using the same process
in our tests.

Many test cases actually do a bunch of their own setup. Sometimes
they duplicate a lot of what bootstrap already provides. Other times
test modules just blindly inherit from ``core.TestCase`` to get
things works. This isn't ideal because it isn't DRY. It also becomes
really easy to tack on extra cycles to each test when things are
added to the generic ``load_fixtures`` method that is typically run
for each test.

Instead, we can try and reuse what we give to operators for our
testing. This will:

  - Reduce duplicate setup scenarios across test modules
  - Reduce extra resource creation and cleanup when it's not needed
    for a particular set of test
  - Enforces better readability if each test case assumes the same
    basic structure of data present after bootstrap, test classes
    that need addition resources should include those in their
    setUp or setUpClass methods
  - We engrain the testing of a tool we provide to operators into
    our testing environment

This commit helps us move in that direction by encapsulating the
logic for bootstrapping deployments into a reusable object that is
accessible by both the tests and the cli tooling.

Change-Id: I84c75076405e6af9356f79778f2d2e67855f4fe0

This looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2017-12-11 12:47:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

So the problem here is that we have nested usage of the limiting reader we need to fix as discussed in IRC last week.

This specific case we use it here for doing quota enforcement and deeper down in the layers we check the max image size with the same limiting reader which will be raised all the way to this same point. Now which ever way we do it currently (either follow this patch and remove the quota warning or keep the quota warning) we hide the other error ever popping up and just flip the issue.

I think we need to change the limiting reader to accept exception class as parameter (together with the limit) so we can pass the StorageQuotaFull here when we set it up and get the limiting reader to raise different exceptions when it's nested with different limits.

Last thing I want to see is us proxying it as something else and putting yet another abstraction layer on top of it."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2017-12-13 05:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2017-12-13 05:35:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

 > StorageQuotaFull here when we set it up and get the limiting reader
 > to raise different exceptions when it's nested with different
 > limits.
 > 
 > Last thing I want to see is us proxying it as something else and
 > putting yet another abstraction layer on top of it.

Hi Erno,

Hope you are looking for something like this. With this change I can get different error messages for quota and image size cap gets over the limit."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-05-14 15:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25695, 'date': '2018-05-29 06:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-05-29 13:17:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Code looks good; I think you need to make some corrections in the commit message, though.

It would be nice to have a test for this, because we have pretty full unit test coverage on the LimitingReader and the quotas, but this problem still slipped through.  On the other hand, it's not going to be an easy test to write.  I'll settle for an update on the bug report showing that you get the correct error message using the current code.  (You have a log extract on the bug, but I think it's from a previous patch.)"}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-05-30 05:07:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-05-30 05:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix unreachable 'ImageSizeLimitExceeded' exception in image-upload

ImageSizeLimitExceeded exception block [1] is unreachable in upload because
it is caught at [2] and raised StorageQuotaFull exception from there. The
problem here is that we have nested usage of the limiting reader.

To make it correct changed the limiting reader to accept
exception class as parameter so that we can pass the StorageQuotaFull
in case LimitingReader is used for quota check and ImageSizeExceeded exception
if it is used for image size cap check.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/fd16fa4f258fd3f77c14900a019e97bb90bc5ac0/glance/api/v2/image_data.py#L230
[2] https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/fd16fa4f258fd3f77c14900a019e97bb90bc5ac0/glance/quota/__init__.py#L305

Closes-Bug: #1734832
Change-Id: I5a419b763bee7f983c2a94c6f3a2245281e86743

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-02 02:10:00.000000000', 'message': 'Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_bad_authorizing_roles_id

The `test_bad_authorizing_roles_id` was using .admin_request and not
actually hitting the routed controller method as .admin_request does
not prepend /v3 to the url returned from ._authoriz_request_token.

`test_bad_authorizing_roles_id` was therefore erroneously expecting a
404 response instead of a proper 401 indicating the user is not
authorized due to not having the expected role_id.

Due to the policy enforcement, it was required to generate a NEW role
to do the oauth1 workflow on, so that the user was still allowed to
interact with the controller method (which would also generate a 401,
but at the wrong phase of the data flow).

Change-Id: Ia36c2a4400c761ac78f065b332d7789ca5ce9a04
'}]
commit_message:
Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_bad_authorizing_roles_id

The `test_bad_authorizing_roles_id` was using .admin_request and not
actually hitting the routed controller method as .admin_request does
not prepend /v3 to the url returned from ._authoriz_request_token.

`test_bad_authorizing_roles_id` was therefore erroneously expecting a
404 response instead of a proper 401 indicating the user is not
authorized due to not having the expected role_id.

Due to the policy enforcement, it was required to generate a NEW role
to do the oauth1 workflow on, so that the user was still allowed to
interact with the controller method (which would also generate a 401,
but at the wrong phase of the data flow).

Change-Id: Ia36c2a4400c761ac78f065b332d7789ca5ce9a04

(The jobs are specified in the 'experimental' queue on this
patch so we can see that they are working as expected.)

Change-Id: I0385646991140debc06ea27a194a6e7f6f749e6b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571005/

commit_message:
Add periodic tips jobs

Add jobs to the periodic queue that run the glance unit and
functional tests against the master of various libraries we
consume so that we don't have to wait for a release to detect
a change that could be problematic.

The dependency is needed for the *glance_store-tips jobs to
be processed properly.

Change-Id: I0385646991140debc06ea27a194a6e7f6f749e6b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571005/

commit_message:
Don't share a network with all tenants

Other tenants may appreciate random networks not popping up for
miliseconds in their net-list; and other test cases executed in parallel
may also benefit, especially when they e.g. attempt to validate net-list
result; or boot an instance w/o specifying a port or network to use.

There is still more work on tempest tests side.

Original patch was for neutron-tempest-plugin:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550987/
and this is only backport to stable/Pike branch which still
uses tempest tests from neutron repo.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571677/
Change-Id: I88eaa1bb65482557912c2d304800d782e730a6b6
Closes-Bug: #1753209

commit_message:
Implement provider drivers - L7 Rules

This patch adds provider driver support to the Octavia v2
L7 Rules API.

This patch also creates a provider driver for Octavia, fully
implementing the L7 rules methods.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/570485
Change-Id: I282a98a6ccb87e9ca94a0e5d47184d23cc28b253
Story: 1655768
Task: 5165

commit_message:
Implement provider drivers - L7 Policy

This patch adds provider driver support to the Octavia v2
L7 Policy API.

This patch also creates a provider driver for Octavia, fully
implementing the L7 policy methods.

https://review.openstack.org/570482
Change-Id: I242d3f40ea4bfeb0ce48f990a5fc4433638b6281
Story: 1655768
Task: 5165

commit_message:
Implement provider drivers - Health Monitor

This patch adds provider driver support to the Octavia v2
Health Monitor API.

This patch also creates a provider driver for Octavia, fully
implementing the health monitor methods.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/567688
Change-Id: Ia0020690f0ef14d391c66e6b531478efc6f0d489
Story: 1655768
Task: 5165

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 09:48:59.000000000', 'message': "tests: port test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion

The test was originally implemented in this form as a tempest api test
case, but there is a problem with it being part of tempest suite,
because the suite should be safe to execute on a running cloud and
shouldn't affect other tenants. But sharing a network with everyone (*)
briefly impacts other tenants because they see a new shared network
popping up for a second in their net-list. It is also an issue because
if we are unlucky enough, some other tenant may start an instance
without specifying a particular port or network to use, in which case
there is a chance that nova allocates a port in this shared network and
attach it to the instance. When the rbac test case then tries to delete
the policy and the network, it fails because it's still in use.

The solution is to stop testing this scenario in tempest suite, instead
moving it into unit test suite.

A follow-up patch in neutron-tempest-plugin will clean up the bad test
case.

Change-Id: I199f639c95e8ae884ede46404370d7b64da3b309
Needed-By: Iba89a53b2715cf3a9c7485f2089f27d547fea308
Related-Bug: #1753209
(cherry picked from commit 6c772de103e469ad17cdbc6a86ed15655aa6b9cc)
"}]
commit_message:
tests: port test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion

The test was originally implemented in this form as a tempest api test
case, but there is a problem with it being part of tempest suite,
because the suite should be safe to execute on a running cloud and
shouldn't affect other tenants. But sharing a network with everyone (*)
briefly impacts other tenants because they see a new shared network
popping up for a second in their net-list. It is also an issue because
if we are unlucky enough, some other tenant may start an instance
without specifying a particular port or network to use, in which case
there is a chance that nova allocates a port in this shared network and
attach it to the instance. When the rbac test case then tries to delete
the policy and the network, it fails because it's still in use.

The solution is to stop testing this scenario in tempest suite, instead
moving it into unit test suite.

A follow-up patch in neutron-tempest-plugin will clean up the bad test
case.

Change-Id: I199f639c95e8ae884ede46404370d7b64da3b309
Needed-By: Iba89a53b2715cf3a9c7485f2089f27d547fea308
Related-Bug: #1753209
(cherry picked from commit 6c772de103e469ad17cdbc6a86ed15655aa6b9cc)
