revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 08:20:02.000000000', 'message': "Add plumbing for Contrail/Tungsten Fabric offloads

* This change expands the VNIC type support for the vrouter VIF type by
  adding 'direct' and 'virtio-forwarder' plugging support.

* After this change, the vrouter VIF type will support the following three
  modes:
  * 'normal': the 'classic' tap-style VNIC plugged into the instance,
  * 'direct': a PCI Virtual Function is passed through to the instance,
  * 'virtio-forwarder': a PCI Virtual Function is proxied to the
    instance via a vhost-user virtio forwarder.

* The libvirt xml generation code was updated to support the modes.

* The Nova legacy VIF plugging code was updated to support the modes.

* The privsep wrapper for the vrouter port control binary was updated.

* The vrouter VIF unit test cases were refreshed and extended.

* The corresponding review on OpenContrail is currently at:
  https://review.opencontrail.org/#/c/42850/

Change-Id: Iea71323562a14379a78672c12027cd8e73547e68
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add plumbing for Contrail/Tungsten Fabric offloads

* This change expands the VNIC type support for the vrouter VIF type by
  adding 'direct' and 'virtio-forwarder' plugging support.

* After this change, the vrouter VIF type will support the following three
  modes:
  * 'normal': the 'classic' tap-style VNIC plugged into the instance,
  * 'direct': a PCI Virtual Function is passed through to the instance,
  * 'virtio-forwarder': a PCI Virtual Function is proxied to the
    instance via a vhost-user virtio forwarder.

* The libvirt xml generation code was updated to support the modes.

* The Nova legacy VIF plugging code was updated to support the modes.

* The privsep wrapper for the vrouter port control binary was updated.

* The vrouter VIF unit test cases were refreshed and extended.

* The corresponding review on OpenContrail is currently at:
  https://review.opencontrail.org/#/c/42850/

Change-Id: Iea71323562a14379a78672c12027cd8e73547e68
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>

Create ansible-role-openstacksdk role

We'll be using this role for windmill to help manage openstacksdk
project. We'll be publishing IRC notications and not applying for
official openstack project.

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

because novaclient had removed some functionality that openstackclient
needed for providing floating ip and host commands. So we had to leave
the constraint at 9.1.1 pike for novaclient, but this prevented users

commit_message:
Update constraint for python-novaclient to 10.1.0

This constraint update was originally tried [1] awhile back and failed
because novaclient had removed some functionality that openstackclient
needed for providing floating ip and host commands. So we had to leave
the constraint at 9.1.1 pike for novaclient, but this prevented users
from being able to use the volume multi-attach feature out-of-the-box
in queens.

To improve the situation for users, the openstackclient stable branch
team allowed us to backport changes to stable/queens that would make
queens openstackclient work with novaclient 10.1.0 (queens). We have
requested a new release with those changes as a dependency here.

Once openstackclient 3.14.2 for queens is released, we would like to
update the constraint for novaclient queens to 10.1.0 to enable use
of the volume multi-attach feature out-of-the-box for queens.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/538070

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571537

Change-Id: I6e6b5dd95b0d5f54b3e8e2fce5bf303e91de42b7

commit_message:
Remove trusty beaker job template

The only project that was using this template was puppet-infracloud,
which doesn't really need it. Clean up the template, the job and the
supporting playbooks to make migrating the beaker jobs to zuulv3 easier.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571024
Change-Id: I4df3fb0207cf421656a6e6b62712ed6abbcea0ad

subject: Add support for OVN hw offloading in containers
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 12171, 'name': 'Moshe Levi', 'email': 'moshele@nvidia.com', 'username': 'moshele'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27585, 'name': 'Sulaiman Radwan', 'email': 'sulaimanrad@mellanox.com', 'username': 'sulaimanrad'}]

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-02-27 04:34:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2018-06-03 09:39:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Sulaiman - In your testing with OVN, does ovn-controller reply to the DHCP requests from the VMs with hw offloading ?

I think for SRIOV deployments, ovn-controller may not be able to reply. Do you have comments on this ?

I was planning to submit a patch to "not to disable dhcp agent" in neutron-ovn-hw-offload.yaml'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-06-03 10:18:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> @Sulaiman - In your testing with OVN, does ovn-controller reply to
 > the DHCP requests from the VMs with hw offloading ?
 > 
 > I think for SRIOV deployments, ovn-controller may not be able to
 > reply. Do you have comments on this ?
 > 
 > I was planning to submit a patch to "not to disable dhcp agent" in
 > neutron-ovn-hw-offload.yaml

It worked for us. So If I remember correctly ovn just do send to controller action right? This action is not offloaded but go via the kernel datapath which is fine. Can you explain why you think it will not work?'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2018-06-04 07:02:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > @Sulaiman - In your testing with OVN, does ovn-controller reply
 > to
 > > the DHCP requests from the VMs with hw offloading ?
 > >
 > > I think for SRIOV deployments, ovn-controller may not be able to
 > > reply. Do you have comments on this ?
 > >
 > > I was planning to submit a patch to "not to disable dhcp agent"
 > in
 > > neutron-ovn-hw-offload.yaml
 > 
 > It worked for us. So If I remember correctly ovn just do send to
 > controller action right? This action is not offloaded but go via
 > the kernel datapath which is fine. Can you explain why you think it
 > will not work?

Thanks for the update. That's right, DHCP request is handled using controller action. I don't have much idea on hw offload and SRIOV. Hence the question.

Do you have any idea about SRIOV deployments ? How would it work. If I am right, we also need neutron sriov agent to support it with OVN . In that case when the VM boots and sends the DHCP request will the packet hit the controller action and get the reply from ovn-controller ?

I will do some testing to figure out. But let me know if you have any comments.

Thanks again'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-06-04 11:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > > @Sulaiman - In your testing with OVN, does ovn-controller reply
 > > to
 > > > the DHCP requests from the VMs with hw offloading ?
 > > >
 > > > I think for SRIOV deployments, ovn-controller may not be able
 > to
 > > > reply. Do you have comments on this ?
 > > >
 > > > I was planning to submit a patch to "not to disable dhcp agent"
 > > in
 > > > neutron-ovn-hw-offload.yaml
 > >
 > > It worked for us. So If I remember correctly ovn just do send to
 > > controller action right? This action is not offloaded but go via
 > > the kernel datapath which is fine. Can you explain why you think
 > it
 > > will not work?
 > 
 > Thanks for the update. That's right, DHCP request is handled using
 > controller action. I don't have much idea on hw offload and SRIOV.
 > Hence the question.
 > 
 > Do you have any idea about SRIOV deployments ? How would it work.
 > If I am right, we also need neutron sriov agent to support it with
 > OVN . In that case when the VM boots and sends the DHCP request
 > will the packet hit the controller action and get the reply from
 > ovn-controller ?
 > 
 > I will do some testing to figure out. But let me know if you have
 > any comments.
 > 
 > Thanks again
So there are 2 things there is SR-IOV legacy which is using sriovnicswitch and there is ovs hardware offload which  is SR-IOV switchdev which use ovn mechanism driver. So if you are referring to SR-IOV legacy you will need to use neutron-dhcp as legacy SR-IOV don't support send to controller. if you are talk about ovs-offload that should work as send to controller is support but not offloaded.
Does this answer you questions?'}]

commit_message:
Following the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface [1]
as described in [2]

[1]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
[2]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

doc8 command is dropped from docs tox envs.
So this affect nothing and run in PEP8.

Related-Bug: #1765348

Depends-On: Icc7fe3a8f9716281de88825e9d5b2fd84de3d00a
Change-Id: Idf9a16111479ccc64004eac9508da575822a3df5

messages: [{'account_id': 27781, 'date': '2018-06-01 02:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-06-01 08:50:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9820, 'date': '2018-06-03 00:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-06-04 11:06:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 02:32:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add freezer-scheduler hosts into site.yml

freezer-scheduer container will run on freezer-scheduler hosts[0],
but it missing in site.yml, when freezer-api and freezer-scheduler
run on different hosts, it will failed.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/inventory/multinode#L376

Change-Id: I1bd36c7c57345ee63cd153df8bd0603badf0d8a2
'}]
commit_message:
Add freezer-scheduler hosts into site.yml

freezer-scheduer container will run on freezer-scheduler hosts[0],
but it missing in site.yml, when freezer-api and freezer-scheduler
run on different hosts, it will failed.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/inventory/multinode#L376

Change-Id: I1bd36c7c57345ee63cd153df8bd0603badf0d8a2

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ia0b4a547c7f50542c90278ee351d770e2e500407
Co-Authored-By: Michel Peterson <michel@redhat.com>

subject: Remove non-building monasca-ceilometer
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 20:37:21.000000000', 'message': "Remove non-building monasca-ceilometer

stable/queens tarball of monasca-ceilometer seems nonbuilding (refers
to stable/pike's ceilometer) and upstream seems unwilling to fix it.
remove the package.

Change-Id: I1895d071dc945b665a986f04fa2004e293737266
"}]
commit_message:
Remove non-building monasca-ceilometer

stable/queens tarball of monasca-ceilometer seems nonbuilding (refers
to stable/pike's ceilometer) and upstream seems unwilling to fix it.
remove the package.

Change-Id: I1895d071dc945b665a986f04fa2004e293737266

commit_message:
Use real package name

In the mitaka cycle, the Ubuntu neutron plugin packages
were renamed, and transitional packages were created.

Use the real name of the linuxbridge plugin package to
reflect reality.

Change-Id: I12e1ee45b7a9cfee0d42ba66a34d2e5f4267ca2e
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <charles.short@ericsson.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-31 12:37:33.000000000', 'message': "Pass virtio multiqueue info to os-vif plugins

 * The VIFGeneric os-vif type is used for the kernel TAP based
   plugging. The os-vif plugin has to create a multiqueue TAP device if
   multiqueue is desired.
 * In order to pass the multiqueue hint to the os-vif plugin, os-vif
   needs to be extended with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570959
 * It's possible to pass this hint via the VIF object, but it's a
   lot less invasive to pass it via the instance information.
 * Update the multiqueue check: some tests can call it with an
   incomplete instance. In that case, the fallback is single queue
   anyway.

Depends-On: Ifbc44337c09e0f2ccf421798803ff7e794ed0b70
Change-Id: I1a449c3d77309193b22caadb9e48323d7b1510c6
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-05-31 21:57:20.000000000', 'message': "Pass virtio multiqueue info to os-vif plugins

 * The VIFGeneric os-vif type is used for the kernel TAP based
   plugging. The os-vif plugin has to create a multiqueue TAP device if
   multiqueue is desired.
 * This hint is passed by checking the port_profile of the os-vif object
   for the 'virtio_multiqueue' field before plugging. If it exists and
   is 'None', it is updated with the result from the multiqueue check.
 * Update the multiqueue check to take an instance.
 * Update the unit tests to correctly mock the instance object for
   multiple testcases.
 * Added unit tests for the multiqueue check.
 * The first os-vif port profile to support the virtio_multiqueue field
   is in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570959

Depends-On: Ifbc44337c09e0f2ccf421798803ff7e794ed0b70
Change-Id: I1a449c3d77309193b22caadb9e48323d7b1510c6

"}, {'created': '2018-06-01 13:57:56.000000000', 'message': "Pass virtio multiqueue info to os-vif plugins

 * The VIFGeneric os-vif type is used for the kernel TAP based

commit_message:
Pass virtio multiqueue info to os-vif plugins

 * The VIFGeneric os-vif type is used for the kernel TAP based
   plugging. If the os-vif plugin has not created a TAP device, the
   hypervisor will create one (multiqueue enabled, if set). If the
   os-vif plugin has to create a multiqueue TAP device, it needs a hint
   if multiqueue is desired.
 * This hint is passed by checking the port_profile of the os-vif object
   for the 'virtio_multiqueue' field before plugging. If it exists and
   is 'None', it is updated with the result from the multiqueue check.
 * Update the multiqueue check to take an instance.
 * Update the unit tests to correctly mock the instance object for
   multiple testcases.
 * Added unit tests for the multiqueue check.
 * The first os-vif port profile to support the virtio_multiqueue field
   is in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570959
 * Until the above review is merged, writing testcases for this codepath
   is problematic.

Depends-On: Ifbc44337c09e0f2ccf421798803ff7e794ed0b70
Change-Id: I1a449c3d77309193b22caadb9e48323d7b1510c6
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-31 21:45:29.000000000', 'message': "Mention neutron-rootwrap-daemon in root_helper_daemon option help

An operators mailing list thread [1] discussing scale issues
where vif plugging times out eventually came to the conclusion
that several operators run rootwrap in the neutron agent in daemon
mode.

This ability is not clear from the configuration option help, however,
so this change adds more details on running in this mode to achieve
scale. Another nice discussion about this can be found here [2].

There is a corresponding nova patch [3] to mention this option
if operators are hitting vif plugging timeouts in nova.

This doesn't change any defaults, it just improves the documentation.

The help text formatting is also updated for easier readability
and maintainability in the source.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-May/015364.html
[2] https://cloudblog.switch.ch/2017/08/28/starting-1000-instances-on-switchengines/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/571577/

Change-Id: I8b8a0cfea409c3469ad0ee223c87e0380b3afbad
Closes-Bug: #1774217
"}]
commit_message:
Mention neutron-rootwrap-daemon in root_helper_daemon option help

An operators mailing list thread [1] discussing scale issues
where vif plugging times out eventually came to the conclusion
that several operators run rootwrap in the neutron agent in daemon
mode.

This ability is not clear from the configuration option help, however,
so this change adds more details on running in this mode to achieve
scale. Another nice discussion about this can be found here [2].

There is a corresponding nova patch [3] to mention this option
if operators are hitting vif plugging timeouts in nova.

This doesn't change any defaults, it just improves the documentation.

The help text formatting is also updated for easier readability
and maintainability in the source.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-May/015364.html
[2] https://cloudblog.switch.ch/2017/08/28/starting-1000-instances-on-switchengines/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/571577/

Change-Id: I8b8a0cfea409c3469ad0ee223c87e0380b3afbad
Closes-Bug: #1774217

commit_message:
Bump Ubuntu base image to 18.04

Ubuntu 18.04 has been released. We need upgrade to it this cycle.

Changes made in this patch

- Bump ubuntu repo from xenial to bionic. Some repos do not have bionic
  packages, so still using xenial repos.
- Drop mariadb, percona and nfs-ganesha repo, because these packages are
  already provided by Ubuntu official repo.
- Since qdrouterd does not have bionic repo and xenial packages does not
  work on Ubuntu bionic, just add it into ignore image list.
- Use python-rtslib-fb and targetcli-fb rather than python-rtslib
  and targetcli
- use xen-utils package name rather than with package version one.
- Seems unsigned repo won't work on Ubuntu bionic, stop using infra
  mirrored unsigned repo in gate building job.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/568728
Implement blueprint: ubuntu-bionic
Change-Id: I4e3b0ca669cfbf6316bf591f2d8428fa1a0d6182

commit_message:
Really ignore unsupported service types

Due to how Kuryr implements service networking, NodePort services are
not supported and nobody brought up a good case for their support.
Without this fix, we'd not generate a proper spec but we'd try to
process them ending up in failure.

Change-Id: I1e02a7a7fdfd2a49b0759f959adedf038bf1ca6e
Closes-Bug: #1774634
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
(cherry picked from commit 71864e8cdd255f015eb82946e6ee3861fbbb5e08)

This also changes stack_get_all_by_owner_id() to not select the

commit_message:
Don't allow nested or stacks in FAILED state to be migrated

Stack and its nested stacks should be in *_COMPLETE state for
it to be migrated. Also, we should not allow migration of a
nested stack.

This also changes stack_get_all_by_owner_id() to not select the
backup stacks. This seems to be used only in convergence code
path and migrate_convergence_1().

Change-Id: Icd54465d0c593557a12d853ddee4ee8ce6483499
Closes-Bug: #1767962
Story: #1767962
Task: #17363
(cherry picked from commit abfec544d7938ad8b576e1d0fa78f8a5dca1df00)

subject: Move database creation into role
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-06-01 14:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-01 21:12:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-06-04 09:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 14:29:26.000000000', 'message': "Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'heat_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable heat_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: I5f3e73af031aad455dbd8555aa054eac804a55bb
"}]
commit_message:
Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'heat_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable heat_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: I5f3e73af031aad455dbd8555aa054eac804a55bb

commit_message:
Fix local path for templates outside of the plan

In some cases, the local path of templates can be
wrong. For example, if a local path have double
slash, this will result to a failure when the
deployment workflow will launch http request with
double slash.

Change-Id: I91a38cbc6b67bdc5e6303f3ae1930f77103d7987
(cherry picked from commit 18c3ec423309b1fdf2164bbb290c3076d96b3801)

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for barbican

Provide support fot kolla dev mode in barbican. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'barbican_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of barbican project is cloned
and bindmounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: I8d48c43cf599548b4536285759ed0078f359538e

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

for more details.

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

Update PrettyTable dependency so the tests pass.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I59c771ca583fb0ebc9f39314ee68264410f8a173
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix sudoers for Ceph

Since moving ansible to a virtualenv in the toolbox Ceph could not run
find_disks.

Change-Id: I8bce61887273f1c27ab79edec947d36a3aab3c48

commit_message:
Pike to Queens controller upgrade guard rerun with no images

As discussed at [0] if current overcloud resources are removed
manually/some error, and even container images deleted, the
upgrade tasks should be able to guard.

We already have a similar guard for the fetch&retag at [1]

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1584809
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/8824e7abcde38b14236de0e4f172ac99852f62b4/docker/services/pacemaker/haproxy.yaml#L305-L324

Change-Id: I2c81e6d0f73fbef0f2a347b9fd4d27df91c2fdd1

commit_message:
Ensure WorkflowSteps resource is enabled in ceph-upgrade-prepare

To trigger ceph-ansible we need to make sure the WorkfowSteps
resource is enabled in ceph-upgrade-prepare env file.

Change-Id: Id760305971a68c397f9334265dd023b1e1884295
Closes-Bug: 1774647

commit_message:
change ansible command in ansible_sudoers

since ansible was moved to virtualenv in kolla_toolbox, the default
executable path was changed to /opt/ansible/bin/ansible. Hence the
ansible command in ansible_sudoers need to be changed correspondingly
in order to ensure kolla-ansible "sudo -E" in container kolla-toolbox
can be executed without hanging.

Closes-Bug: #1773911

Change-Id: Ib9e4899e710e77e7fa5fbaf5c210fe445cdbc6ac
Signed-off-by: Nan Li <herbert.nan@linaro.org>

commit_message:
Use multipathd hostgroup in the multipathd role

There is already a multipathd hostgroup in the inventory.
This hostgroup should be used in this role.

Change-Id: If0cc0f8e4b81f71c40357bdba66bc2c62d72dfd8

commit_message:
Fix broken gate due to breaking dependency changes

PyKMIP changes:

The CredentialType is no longer imported into the credentials
module.  Fixed the reference.  Skipping the accept header tests
till the webob fix is available.

WebOb 1.8.1 changes:

This patch updates the Accept header logic that was broken
by the update in the WebOb dependency.

In the interest of time I had to comment out four functional tests
that will require further work in the content negotiation logic so
we can get the gate working again.

Also shame on the WebOb folks for not bumping the major version
on this breaking change.

Change-Id: Ie4d0df0cca2c79686830931e96b11bbc97a41c5b
Story: 2002122

commit_message:
Pin cmd2 to the last python2 version of the library

The cmd2-0.9.0 is python3-only and the tempest venv is built
unconstrained, so it's trying to bring in the latest version
which is incompatible with python2. We pin the library to
ensure that the venv build completes correctly.

Depends-On: I35e3688ae632d5f7747f32dafc41d23883c033c5
Change-Id: Id5b9274ce39dec3d5ee295d7ef941bf42ca7cbd2
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add test to shelve the paused server: bug# 1745529

This commit adds test to shelve the paused instance.
As per Nova doc[1], user should be able to shelve the instance
even it is in paused state but this is not happening as per
mentioned bugs and there was no coverage of this scenario in tempest.

..1 https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#shelve-server-shelve-action
Related-Bug: #1745529

Depends-On: I8ca25d9847d50001fbe8513a6c1dba8b697c24e4

commit_message:
Update attach_volume and detach_volume policy rules

The prior commit for this was functional but not quite
correct. The policy rules currently in Horizon for
attach and detach of volumes don't exist in Nova and
are missing from the local copy of nova_policy.json and
from Nova generated policy files. The fix to use the
create instance copy of the rule only worked for attach
and not detach ( https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570071/ )

This commit updates detach as well, and should be correct
going forward based on the Nova policy rules at:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/policies/volumes_attachments.py

Change-Id: I07fccd6f12149cd88a049c46aa113dfd2b60bbaa
Closes-bug: 1772759

commit_message:
Add ConfFixture.transport_url

As the first step towards removing rpc_backend, we need all of the test
fixtures to stop setting/using it via ConfFixture.transport_driver. Add
ConfFixture.transport_url, and move the tests over to setting it rather
than transport_driver.

Partial-Bug: #1712399
Change-Id: I6e2ae2b511fdc52790d5755a9aecaf2f427ab706

commit_message:
Fix issue with uploading image to glance on Python3

It was unable to upload image when horizon was running on python3,
there was a problem with closed file in new thread. This commit is
fixing this issue with added if clause whether horizon running on
python2 or python3 and correctly call close_called on file when
running on python3.

Change-Id: Ice178f6269ac527ba62b26d86976b5336987c922
Closes-Bug: #1773935

messages: [{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-06-01 21:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-01 22:10:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2018-06-04 05:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 21:29:26.000000000', 'message': 'Remove erroneous newline in sample generation

The sample generation code for policies has a couple different cases
that make sure deprecated rules have descriptions and reasoning
formatted in the comment section. One of the cases that handles
policies deprecated for removal was injecting an extra newline in the
comment text that threw off the formatting of the sample, leaving
the subsequent policy uncommented, and visually unpleasing.

This commit removes the extra newline in the formatting logic for
deprecated policies and adds a test case for the behavior.

Change-Id: I76338d2fbaccf3b43e0da04732fd9df3c05dfbda
Closes-Bug: 1771442
'}]
commit_message:
Remove erroneous newline in sample generation

The sample generation code for policies has a couple different cases
that make sure deprecated rules have descriptions and reasoning
formatted in the comment section. One of the cases that handles
policies deprecated for removal was injecting an extra newline in the
comment text that threw off the formatting of the sample, leaving
the subsequent policy uncommented, and visually unpleasing.

This commit removes the extra newline in the formatting logic for
deprecated policies and adds a test case for the behavior.

Change-Id: I76338d2fbaccf3b43e0da04732fd9df3c05dfbda
Closes-Bug: 1771442

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ifd63d03d98fe51c5c1daa581f521608c3687897c

commit_message:
Do not sync time after restarting of node

We have weird bug that can spawn 2 ntpd processes at the same time
by HA mechanism. Actually we have to sync time strictly only after
reverting a snapshot.

Change-Id: Ic73eb942eaacb436629841f9b12df844f3ac736d
Related-bug:1656020

[{'created': '2017-03-28 10:08:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add timeout to check_service_was_restated

There is the function to check that service was restarted. And there is
test case two_clusters_reconfiguration, which uploads openstack-config
with
  notify: Service[nova-scheduler]
and checks that puppet restarts the nova-scheduler.

Unfortunately, there is a time gap between uploading config to nailgun
and applying puppet on a node. So we have to add a timeout to the
checker for covering that case.

Change-Id: Icef1e15489727a13a753b9921df0cc5527f9ab2d
'}, {'created': '2017-03-28 10:10:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add timeout to check_service_was_restated

There is the function to check that service was restarted. And there is
test case two_clusters_reconfiguration, which uploads openstack-config
with
  notify: Service[nova-scheduler]
and checks that puppet restarts the nova-scheduler.

Unfortunately, there is a time gap between uploading config to nailgun
and applying puppet on a node. So we have to add a timeout to the

commit_message:
add waiting of a deploy finishment to check_service_was_restated

There is the function to check that service was restarted. And there is
test case two_clusters_reconfiguration, which uploads openstack-config
with
  notify: Service[nova-scheduler]
and checks that puppet restarts the nova-scheduler.

Actually deployment process requires a time. So we have to wait when it
finished before checking nova-scheduler.

Closes-bug: #1673750
Change-Id: Icef1e15489727a13a753b9921df0cc5527f9ab2d

commit_message:
Change disk size check

Sometimes order of disks can be changed. So we need
to select disk using type ("qcow2" by default) but
not by index.

Change-Id: I481eb79eff22b990c61d2397d6c96bd93df6687f
Closes-Bug: 1670711
(cherry picked from commit 3d22d0c2662c6586f16a32e37a6f20e4a6889692)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 13:10:40.000000000', 'message': "Really ignore unsupported service types

Due to how Kuryr implements service networking, NodePort services are
not supported and nobody brought up a good case for their support.
Without this fix, we'd not generate a proper spec but we'd try to
process them ending up in failure.

Change-Id: I1e02a7a7fdfd2a49b0759f959adedf038bf1ca6e
Closes-Bug: #1774634
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Really ignore unsupported service types

Due to how Kuryr implements service networking, NodePort services are
not supported and nobody brought up a good case for their support.
Without this fix, we'd not generate a proper spec but we'd try to
process them ending up in failure.

Change-Id: I1e02a7a7fdfd2a49b0759f959adedf038bf1ca6e
Closes-Bug: #1774634
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

the reference service image didn't include much of the stuff one
finds in typical systems.

-1 because you've updated the functional code without making a
corresponding change in the unit tests at
manila/tests/share/drivers/test_generic.py.

the right fix."}, {'account_id': 20099, 'date': '2016-11-14 09:41:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2016-11-14 10:26:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Fix share-service VM restart problem

The /etc/mtab file may have mount information such as 'nfsd'
that if copied to /etc/fstab will cause the share server to
hang when rebooted.

Update /etc/fstab with exactly the newly mounted or unmounted
shares rather than simply overwriting /etc/fstab with /etc/mtab.

Change-Id: I67602bae1f928769d768008deca7bd0f2fef1ac2
Close-Bug: #1639662

Ignore the 'undefined datasource' severity

function.

commit_message:
Wire in header microversion into negotiation

In order to properly error and prevent a user
defined override version from being saved, we
need to explicitly check and fail accordingly.

Related-Bug: #1739440
Story: #2001870
Task: #14324
Change-Id: I281224b3de33b7c0c00ed777870df8002e23c4ea

If you have any questions on how to provide meaningful reviews please feel free to reach out to myself of the TC'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-06-01 06:17:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Pretty much says it all:

 This version of Django requires Python 3.4, but you're trying to install it on Python 2.7.

http://logs.openstack.org/60/571060/1/check/legacy-requirements-integration-dsvm/e006e90/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-05-31_05_43_51_368938"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-06-01 06:17:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think the way to go here is to merge your 2 Django changes into one'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-06-01 06:26:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-06-01 09:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-06-02 19:02:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-06-02 19:59:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-06-04 03:10:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think we need to also add the minimum django version fro python3.

Once the change lands our lower-constratints.txt[1] will install 1.11 regardless of python version, is that correct or do we need to add something like:

 Django===1.11;python_version<'3.0'
 Django===2.0;python_version>'3.0'

[1]http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/tree/lower-constraints.txt#n391"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-06-04 03:46:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Django 1.11 supports both python2 and python3 and this version is the last release which suppors python2. Django 2.0 or later release supports python 3 only. For lower-constraints, requirements.txt in horizon declares Django >=1.11, so we can continue to have Django==1.11 as lower-constraints for both python2 and python3. Horizon lower-constraints job runs with Django 1.11 and Python 3.5 now.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-06-04 03:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Django 1.11 supports both python2 and python3 and this version is
 > the last release which suppors python2. Django 2.0 or later release
 > supports python 3 only. For lower-constraints, requirements.txt in
 > horizon declares Django >=1.11, so we can continue to have
 > Django==1.11 as lower-constraints for both python2 and python3.
 > Horizon lower-constraints job runs with Django 1.11 and Python 3.5
 > now.

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-06-04 03:59:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 02:07:24.000000000', 'message': 'Bump django upper bound

This commit bumps the upper bound of Django to <2.1.
Django 2.x supports only python3, so this change only affects
Django version used in python3. Django versions used in python2
still continues to be Django 1.11 series.

Django minor version change usually contains backward-incompatible
changes and/or drops deprecated features, so the upper bound is not
dropped so that consumers can know which Django versions are supported.

upper-constraints.txt is not bumped now as django 2.0 support
in horizon plugins are on-going effort.

Change-Id: I9ee7ac8d5f807cc09b28417695ff80c181d82786
'}, {'created': '2018-06-01 09:21:57.000000000', 'message': 'Bump django upper bound

This commit bumps the upper bound of Django to <2.1.
Django 2.x supports only python3, so this change only affects
Django version used in python3. Django versions used in python2
still continues to be Django 1.11 series.

Django minor version change usually contains backward-incompatible
changes and/or drops deprecated features, so the upper bound is not
dropped so that consumers can know which Django versions are supported.

upper-constraints.txt is not bumped now as django 2.0 support
in horizon plugins are on-going effort.

Change-Id: I9ee7ac8d5f807cc09b28417695ff80c181d82786
'}]
commit_message:
Bump django upper bound

This commit bumps the upper bound of Django to <2.1.
Django 2.x supports only python3, so this change only affects
Django version used in python3. Django versions used in python2
still continues to be Django 1.11 series.

Django minor version change usually contains backward-incompatible
changes and/or drops deprecated features, so the upper bound is not
dropped so that consumers can know which Django versions are supported.

upper-constraints.txt is not bumped now as django 2.0 support
in horizon plugins are on-going effort.

Change-Id: I9ee7ac8d5f807cc09b28417695ff80c181d82786

commit_message:
libvirt: Skip fetching the virtual size of block devices

In this latest episode of `Which CI job has lyarwood broken today?!` we
find that I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56 introduced a
regression in the nova-lvm experimental job as n-cpu attempted to run
qemu-img info against block devices as an unprivileged user.

For the time being we should skip any attempt to use this command
against block devices until the disk_api layer can make privileged
calls using privsep.

Closes-bug: #1771700
Change-Id: I9653f81ec716f80eb638810f65e2d3cdfeedaa22
(cherry picked from commit fda48219a378d09a9a363078ba161d7f54e32c0a)
(cherry picked from commit 8ea98c56b647526aae7a786531e934eeee7a90a2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-31 09:50:39.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: handle DiskNotFound during update_available_resource

The update_available_resource periodic task in the compute manager
eventually calls through to the resource tracker and virt driver
get_available_resource method, which gets the guests running on
the hypervisor, and builds up a set of information about the host.
This includes disk information for the active domains.

However, the periodic task can race with instances being deleted
concurrently and the hypervisor can report the domain but the driver
has already deleted the backing files as part of deleting the
instance, and this leads to failures when running "qemu-img info"
on the disk path which is now gone.

When that happens, the entire periodic update fails.

This change simply tries to detect the specific failure from
'qemu-img info' and translate it into a DiskNotFound exception which
the driver can handle. In this case, if the associated instance is
undergoing a task state transition such as moving to another host or
being deleted, we log a message and continue. If the instance is in
steady state (task_state is not set), then we consider it a failure
and re-raise it up.

Note that we could add the deleted=False filter to the instance query
in _get_disk_over_committed_size_total but that doesn't help us in
this case because the hypervisor says the domain is still active
and the instance is not actually considered deleted in the DB yet.

Change-Id: Icec2769bf42455853cbe686fb30fda73df791b25
Closes-Bug: #1662867
(cherry picked from commit 5f16e714f58336344752305f94451e7c7c55742c)
(cherry picked from commit 5a4c6913a37f912489543abd5e12a54feeeb89e2)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: handle DiskNotFound during update_available_resource

The update_available_resource periodic task in the compute manager
eventually calls through to the resource tracker and virt driver
get_available_resource method, which gets the guests running on
the hypervisor, and builds up a set of information about the host.
This includes disk information for the active domains.

However, the periodic task can race with instances being deleted
concurrently and the hypervisor can report the domain but the driver
has already deleted the backing files as part of deleting the
instance, and this leads to failures when running "qemu-img info"
on the disk path which is now gone.

When that happens, the entire periodic update fails.

This change simply tries to detect the specific failure from
'qemu-img info' and translate it into a DiskNotFound exception which
the driver can handle. In this case, if the associated instance is
undergoing a task state transition such as moving to another host or
being deleted, we log a message and continue. If the instance is in
steady state (task_state is not set), then we consider it a failure
and re-raise it up.

Note that we could add the deleted=False filter to the instance query
in _get_disk_over_committed_size_total but that doesn't help us in
this case because the hypervisor says the domain is still active
and the instance is not actually considered deleted in the DB yet.

Change-Id: Icec2769bf42455853cbe686fb30fda73df791b25
Closes-Bug: #1662867
(cherry picked from commit 5f16e714f58336344752305f94451e7c7c55742c)
(cherry picked from commit 5a4c6913a37f912489543abd5e12a54feeeb89e2)

commit_message:
Add ceph minor update step

This change adds the step required for running ceph minor update
with ceph-ansible during the minor update workflow.

Change-Id: I6503f146e31836ed38bf5220149edd73c7f3297a
(cherry picked from commit 99ecafd3cee2ce4593105129241285c295e4484a)

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I0b5b080be1fefc8de28f40a4afced16608964b2c
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Prepare gate-check-commit.sh for newton EOL

If we want to still test Ocata upgrades, we need to implement
the workarounds in Newton.

This is to be kept until we consider it's too hard to maintain.
In that case, we can remove the N->O upgrade jobs.

Change-Id: I662dc3fc8cbce59a99c051dd849b791773ae8046

commit_message:
Add some troubleshooting informations

This error could be somewhat difficult to find and as this
documentation file contains the instructions for a Quick Start
the quicker the issue is found and solved the better

Change-Id: I3c184b0af8729f00dbb15f7b5ad610645a901836

[{'account_id': 25998, 'date': '2017-08-29 12:47:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-08-29 12:47:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-29 12:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Update list of broken ACLs to fix

subject: Change lower-constraints for msgpack to 0.5.2
messages:
[{'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-06-03 00:22:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-06-03 02:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-06-03 04:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-06-03 05:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-06-03 05:59:30.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I am just unsure how we're meant to reconcile all the lower constraints across all projects... but ... eh?"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-06-04 03:34:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

> Abandoned

... even so trying to answer the question :)

 > I am just unsure how we're meant to reconcile all the lower
 > constraints across all projects... but ... eh?

We no longer enforce all projects to agree on a minimum.  If some project needs 0.5.1 (and works with all newer versions) and another needs 0.5.2 then that's actually fine.  We rely on all projects agreeing on a maximum version (which is indicated via upper-constraints.txt).

So for olso.serialization you can merge this and then something like:

 $ git diff
 diff --git a/lower-constraints.txt b/lower-constraints.txt
 index 4791fab..d2a212f 100644
 --- a/lower-constraints.txt
 +++ b/lower-constraints.txt
 @@ -17,7 +17,7 @@ mccabe==0.2.1
  mock==2.0.0
  monotonic==0.6
  mox3==0.20.0
 -msgpack==0.5.1
 +msgpack==0.5.2
  netaddr==0.7.18
  netifaces==0.10.4
  os-client-config==1.28.0
 diff --git a/requirements.txt b/requirements.txt
 index 25e2a76..abdd118 100644
 --- a/requirements.txt
 +++ b/requirements.txt
 @@ -9,6 +9,6 @@
  
  pbr!=2.1.0,>=2.0.0 # Apache-2.0
  six>=1.10.0 # MIT
 -msgpack>=0.5.1 # Apache-2.0
 +msgpack>=0.5.2 # Apache-2.0
  oslo.utils>=3.33.0 # Apache-2.0
  pytz>=2013.6 # MIT

is oslo.serialization. and all should be okay."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-03 00:22:18.000000000', 'message': 'Change lower-constraints for msgpack to 0.5.2

Between 0.5.1 and 0.5.2 the msgpack library changed "raw_as_bytes"
to "raw" and subsequently added a very spammy deprecation message.

To support oslo.serialization eliminating the deprecation warning
moving from "encoding='utf-8'" to "raw=False" this moves the lower
constraint to 0.5.2.

Between 0.5.1 and 0.5.2 the msgpack library changed "raw_as_bytes"
to "raw" and subsequently added a very spammy deprecation message.

To support oslo.serialization eliminating the deprecation warning
moving from "encoding='utf-8'" to "raw=False" this moves the lower
constraint to 0.5.2.

Change-Id: I5afc5f013e9076e9248f46502abbd802ceff0700

commit_message:
Change lower-constraints for msgpack to 0.5.2

Between 0.5.1 and 0.5.2 the msgpack library changed "raw_as_bytes"
to "raw" and subsequently added a very spammy deprecation message.

To support oslo.serialization eliminating the deprecation warning
moving from "encoding='utf-8'" to "raw=False" this moves the lower
constraint to 0.5.2.

Change-Id: I5afc5f013e9076e9248f46502abbd802ceff0700

openstackclient for the queens release.

Once openstackclient is released, we can propose an update of the

Change-Id: Ic84cf5f4c7ea358a201c0e23cd4135dafbe680d8
'}]
commit_message:
Release python-openstackclient 3.14.2 (stable/queens)

This contains a change needed to enable novaclient (that supports the
volume multi-attach feature in queens) to work together with
openstackclient for the queens release.

Once openstackclient is released, we can propose an update of the
novaclient constraints from 9.1.1 => 10.1.0 to enable users to be able
to use the volume multi-attach feature in nova out-of-the-box when they
install the queens release of openstack.

Change-Id: Ic84cf5f4c7ea358a201c0e23cd4135dafbe680d8

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated in Queens [1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I2ef330d7f9b632e9a81d22a8edec3c88eb532ff5
(cherry picked from commit f2384d63754592712c1376b88d195dd251c97bcf)

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the nova service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to inventory
* Add release note

Depends-On: If4326a6848d2d32af284fdbb94798eb0b03734d5
Depends-On: I2b09145b60116c029fc85477399c24f94974b61d
Change-Id: Ia95c5c0dfb3cf42bc31dc311dd853db969acc193

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I79be52db2116e47fd29dce14712735768cd340e7
Implements: blueprint deprecate-auth-uri-option
(cherry picked from commit fb6542ee1cbfe0b7c5d4156b995a5ec68931815e)

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I39e64f29e794075ef303d3e1a2c0c1a6a18937b6
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit a9561bbce96a0dc545f18aaa88be0988be2ac3ad)

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the glance service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to inventory
* Add release note

Depends-On: If4326a6848d2d32af284fdbb94798eb0b03734d5
Change-Id: Ib647d87df040c77ee3906b1bf58764ca5f3d765d

[{'created': '2018-05-31 07:41:30.000000000', 'message': 'Do not pip install keystoneclient on the host

The keystoneclient package is being installed on the host by PIP but
that means that a whole bunch of required dependencies are being pulled
in as well.

This brings the host to a rather messed up state when installing
keystone from distro packages, since distribution and
PIP packages are being mixed together. We only need the client to
register the service with keystone so we can simply use the distro
package for that to avoid installing lots of PIP packages on the
host.

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: I90c9e6732e71e153aa37f9bf69bdda679439f8b3
'}]
commit_message:
Do not pip install keystoneclient on the host

The keystoneclient package is being installed on the host by PIP but
that means that a whole bunch of required dependencies are being pulled
in as well.

This brings the host to a rather messed up state when installing
keystone from distro packages, since distribution and
PIP packages are being mixed together. We only need the client to
register the service with keystone so we can simply use the distro
package for that to avoid installing lots of PIP packages on the
host.

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: I90c9e6732e71e153aa37f9bf69bdda679439f8b3

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for adminuri

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for adminuri.

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: I9cb906fa7ffd58af2edc3c6d80d02c1c147f9f9f

commit_message:
Do not pip install keystoneclient on the host

The keystoneclient package is being installed on the host by PIP but
that means that a whole bunch of required dependencies are being pulled
in as well.

This brings the host to a rather messed up state when installing
keystone from distro packages, since distribution and
PIP packages are being mixed together. We only need the client to
register the service with keystone so we can simply use the distro
package for that to avoid installing lots of PIP packages on the
host.

Change-Id: I1247ae07035451087e70f3e1782dd9c25fe1c554
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the heat service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to inventory
* Add release note

Depends-On: If4326a6848d2d32af284fdbb94798eb0b03734d5
Depends-On: I2b09145b60116c029fc85477399c24f94974b61d
Change-Id: I4ee0a94028e7390b319d4e1ceb4ab7f7c28ad9ba

messages:
[{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-31 07:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-05-31 07:58:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

While I think it's a nice approach, I don't think it's the best way to do it. You're now implicitly always relying on the distro packaged version of keystone/openstacksdk to make things work for distro AND source installs. I'd rather have this splitted in two: Keep this approach for distro installs, but change the approach for source installs: make sure the pip package is installed into an ansible venv, and that the ansible_python_interpreter is set for the tasks that require it (or delegate the action to the deploy node).

The advantage of doing so is double:
- First, we can try to NOT have those packages installed, making the containers lighter
- Second, we pave the way for python3 on source installs, by making sure everything is contained."}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-31 08:16:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I understand what you say but we have already discussed this on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562607/

you only need the keystone stuff on the host just to register the service so using the distro package for that should be OK and also keep the host clean from pip stuff'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-06-02 08:21:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This is a good interim measure to progress the distro install work until we use Ansible 2.5 and can replace our keystone module with https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:cleanup-host-pip-installs'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-04 01:25:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-04 01:25:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-31 07:48:58.000000000', 'message': 'Do not pip install keystoneclient on the host

The keystoneclient package is being installed on the host by PIP but
that means that a whole bunch of required dependencies are being pulled
in as well.

This brings the host to a rather messed up state when installing
keystone from distro packages, since distribution and
PIP packages are being mixed together. We only need the client to
register the service with keystone so we can simply use the distro
package for that to avoid installing lots of PIP packages on the
host.

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: I3759995cfb8192145d1b871158c95f594751a759
'}]
commit_message:
Do not pip install keystoneclient on the host

The keystoneclient package is being installed on the host by PIP but
that means that a whole bunch of required dependencies are being pulled
in as well.

This brings the host to a rather messed up state when installing
keystone from distro packages, since distribution and
PIP packages are being mixed together. We only need the client to
register the service with keystone so we can simply use the distro
package for that to avoid installing lots of PIP packages on the
host.

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: I3759995cfb8192145d1b871158c95f594751a759

commit_message:
vars: Do not pull devel packages on distro installations

The devel packages are only needed to build the pip pacakges so we don't
need them when we install packages straight from the distro repos.

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: Id1d30da7dbca35b5a44215a78110971bda6a4263

commit_message:
Be clear about python3: Remove its support

We have never really tested python3 at large scale, and more and
more bugs are filed in stable branches due to dual stack.

We should stick to python2 in the stable branches, which is
what was tested in our gates.

Change-Id: Id4d6dcb6892a7f3b67ee383a29fbbf2771452e9d

commit_message:
Options to enable SSL for backend connections

Currently backend connections are always unencrypted. This adds optional
parameters to configure backend connections with SSL. This is useful for
extra services wich require SSL or to have backend connections to
OpenStack services encrypted in the future.

Change-Id: I6a032962ae987bb1cbc4982fb6ddbd06f8e53936
(cherry picked from commit 2d0f483c843d7bd0db8eb7dc5f2f169714c73169)

commit_message:
[docs] Add reference page with release information

We often get asked about how often we release and
how long it will take for a patch to reach a release.

Hopefully this page will help to answer those questions.

Change-Id: I9189126b641746a44f2d807cfd928653a8cb8233

'}, {'created': '2018-05-15 17:19:07.000000000', 'message': 'Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the neutron service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventories

Depends-On: Ie69d522ee2df4282ce4fc69c2b3f81f4df1da77d
Depends-On: I235bd33a52df5451a62d2c8700a65a1bc093e4d6
Change-Id: I717880458f69870acf75a101481b7776d250ebf4
'}, {'created': '2018-05-16 17:19:09.000000000', 'message': 'Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the neutron service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventories
* Add release note

Depends-On: If4326a6848d2d32af284fdbb94798eb0b03734d5
Depends-On: I2b09145b60116c029fc85477399c24f94974b61d
Change-Id: I717880458f69870acf75a101481b7776d250ebf4

commit_message:
Remove pycrypto from requirements.txt

Openstack stopped using pycrypto for secrets generation a while back
but the requirement remained in requirements.txt.
This patch removes it.

Change-Id: I1c57ae9f903eefaec4e893bac96692b606996c3e
Closes-Bug: #1749574

transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the ironic service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation (added notifications)
* Add oslo.messaging to inventory
* Add release note

Depends-On: If4326a6848d2d32af284fdbb94798eb0b03734d5
Depends-On: I2b09145b60116c029fc85477399c24f94974b61d
Change-Id: I363a888980dfd84b4b586df01fb022dd453dc3de

commit_message:
Default to v3 auth endpoint when version not set

Right now, when a versionless auth endpoint is used, castellan
ends up trying to use a v2 endpoint.  This fix would default to
v3 if the auth_url is versionless.  Similar changes have been made
in other clients like swift for instance (
see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/473740)

Change-Id: I971e8d02c4b3580eba9b6e6658952ef7d45dcb5c

Fix pymip error

The CredentialType is no longer imported into the credentials
module.  Fixed the reference.  Skipping the accept header tests
till the webob fix is available.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 16:21:08.000000000', 'message': 'Raise warning if top-level value is not a dict

Given the following 'parameters.yaml' file:

  resources_query_granular:
    type: string
    in: query
    required: false
    description: |
      Some description here...
  min_version: 1.22

Clearly 'min_version' is indented at the wrong level. However, the error
message is pretty much useless:

  Exception occurred:
    File "./os_api_ref/__init__.py", line 261, in _check_yaml_sorting
      if value['in'] not in sections:
    TypeError: string indices must be integers, not str

It's obvious we should be saying _what_ is causing this issue. Start
doing this by way of an exception.

Change-Id: If68f82de1e3bf37b1ab89f12adf78e0d8d123674

Clearly 'min_version' is indented at the wrong level. However, the error
message is pretty much useless:

  Exception occurred:
    File "./os_api_ref/__init__.py", line 261, in _check_yaml_sorting
      if value['in'] not in sections:
    TypeError: string indices must be integers, not str

It's obvious we should be saying _what_ is causing this issue. Start

Change-Id: If68f82de1e3bf37b1ab89f12adf78e0d8d123674
'}]
commit_message:
Raise warning if top-level value is not a dict

Given the following 'parameters.yaml' file:

  resources_query_granular:
    type: string
    in: query
    required: false
    description: |
      Some description here...
  min_version: 1.22

Clearly 'min_version' is indented at the wrong level. However, the error
message is pretty much useless:

  Exception occurred:
    File "./os_api_ref/__init__.py", line 261, in _check_yaml_sorting
      if value['in'] not in sections:
    TypeError: string indices must be integers, not str

It's obvious we should be saying _what_ is causing this issue. Start
doing this by way of an exception.

Change-Id: If68f82de1e3bf37b1ab89f12adf78e0d8d123674

commit_message:
Fix erroneous ACL for puppet-pacemaker

puppet-pacemaker was recently added and retained tagging and
branching rights in its new ACL. We don't do that anymore,
as things are driven from the openstack/releases repository.

Change-Id: I3f77af2f8019395b33dfd6b6a9a2f9a7a0d986ac

subject: Remove direct tagging/branching for PowerVMStackers
messages: [{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-06-01 14:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-06-01 18:32:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-06-03 20:43:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 14:13:04.000000000', 'message': 'Remove direct tagging/branching for PowerVMStackers

The release process for official OpenStack components now uses
release requests using changes proposed to the openstack/releases
git repository. This allows peer review of release requests,
including version numbers, and run a series of checks to make
sure the release is likely to be successful once the tag is
pushed. The same process supports the creation of additional repo
branches as well. This all ensures that releases are reported
correctly on the releases.openstack.org website.

As a result of this process, nobody needs to push tags directly
or create branches directly. As an official OpenStack project
team, PowerVMStackers has switched to using that process already
for recent releases. However the ACLs were not fixed to remove
direct tagging/branching yet.

Change-Id: I7b9db2c47f226032527405b8d5b0fe29c825e205
'}]
commit_message:
Remove direct tagging/branching for PowerVMStackers

The release process for official OpenStack components now uses
release requests using changes proposed to the openstack/releases
git repository. This allows peer review of release requests,
including version numbers, and run a series of checks to make
sure the release is likely to be successful once the tag is
pushed. The same process supports the creation of additional repo
branches as well. This all ensures that releases are reported
correctly on the releases.openstack.org website.

As a result of this process, nobody needs to push tags directly
or create branches directly. As an official OpenStack project
team, PowerVMStackers has switched to using that process already
for recent releases. However the ACLs were not fixed to remove
direct tagging/branching yet.

Change-Id: I7b9db2c47f226032527405b8d5b0fe29c825e205

I would prefer to manage these directly in the projects, at least at first.  I'm happy to move to central configuration if that's appropriate eventually, but want to make sure we understand how best to fit in :)"}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-05-19 01:57:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-05-19 01:57:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> I would prefer to manage these directly in the projects, at least
 > at first.  I'm happy to move to central configuration if that's
 > appropriate eventually, but want to make sure we understand how
 > best to fit in :)

Fair enough, but I think we should enable them for Deckhand as it's already set up to be compliant with these jobs."}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-05-19 02:18:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-05-19 03:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25907, 'date': '2018-05-19 18:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Felipe, is there something objectionable about doing this within each project?  e.g. here for Deckhand: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569603/'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-05-19 23:22:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Felipe, is there something objectionable about doing this within
 > each project?  e.g. here for Deckhand: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569603/

No, there's nothing intrinsically objectionable about putting it in .zuul.yaml versus project-config. However, your approach runs counter to what literally hundreds of other repositories do and it also runs counter to the cited best practices in the documentation. Please reference: 

* https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html#zuul-best-practices
* https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#what-to-convert

"Note that the standard OpenStack jobs should be in the project-config repository."

I'm not whimsically making a decision here, but following cited procedures and standards.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-05-29 15:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-06-01 18:24:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

As an alternative you can add these jobs to deckhand using your in repo zuul config. Then you don't have to wait on the infra team to make these changes."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-06-03 20:42:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Enable py27/py35 unit test jobs for airship-deckhand

Deckhand already has configured py27 and py35 unit test jobs
in its tox.ini [0][1] and already is configured out-of-the-box
to work with OpenStack job conventions. This is to enable them in Zuul.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/airship-deckhand/blob/e1f22a76c73ef0de648f472d197ac9433524d8be/tox.ini#L21
[1] https://github.com/openstack/airship-deckhand/blob/e1f22a76c73ef0de648f472d197ac9433524d8be/tox.ini#L32

Change-Id: I174d5df008f6e000da1a3878afe75919312ea7aa

commit_message:
Add an explanation for tags

During the education it was noted that we didn't explain
what to do if we had multiple tags in a commit. I added
a note to the page on it. Also there is a missing blank
line in the listings format.

Change-Id: I41c8d4c344bf174fb9ec54c6da6ad285b0a6a02c

subject: Revert "rabbit: Don't prefetch when batch_size is set"
messages: [{'account_id': 24713, 'date': '2018-05-09 06:15:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/ocata.'}, {'account_id': 24713, 'date': '2018-05-09 06:17:00.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1759755-stable/ocata-stable/pike to bug/1759755-stable/pike'}, {'account_id': 24713, 'date': '2018-05-14 07:32:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-05-14 14:15:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2018-06-03 18:18:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 06:15:01.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "rabbit: Don't prefetch when batch_size is set"

This reverts commit c881baed29db49c5710795496cb07907e35ceaba.

Eventhough batch_size is set, rabbitMQ prefetch count is not changed
at the first time of connection creation. It works only connection reset
cases(i.e. rabbitMQ restart). So this patch can not fix original issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1551667

Moreover, it makes another bug that messages of sameple queues are not
consumed properly. So revert it.

Change-Id: Ia8ebee8e2a670e46b6a68859bc30e717bd56ed7e
Signed-off-by: Wonil Choi <wonil22.choi@samsung.com>
Closes-bug: 1759755
(cherry picked from commit e0e8a1ea68bcc33d1a07361102eb87d0cfdd94a9)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "rabbit: Don't prefetch when batch_size is set"

This reverts commit c881baed29db49c5710795496cb07907e35ceaba.

Eventhough batch_size is set, rabbitMQ prefetch count is not changed
at the first time of connection creation. It works only connection reset
cases(i.e. rabbitMQ restart). So this patch can not fix original issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1551667

Moreover, it makes another bug that messages of sameple queues are not
consumed properly. So revert it.

Change-Id: Ia8ebee8e2a670e46b6a68859bc30e717bd56ed7e
Signed-off-by: Wonil Choi <wonil22.choi@samsung.com>
Closes-bug: 1759755
(cherry picked from commit e0e8a1ea68bcc33d1a07361102eb87d0cfdd94a9)

The only thing that bothers me is this - say we have a router that is master (forwarding=1), and we stop the l3-agent there, and while it's not running a fail-over happens.  When we start the l3-agent, since it is standby we will set forwarding=0. [{'created': '2018-05-17 10:20:12.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Disable IPv6 forwarding by default on HA routers

commit_message:
Disable IPv6 forwarding by default on HA routers

In case of HA routers IPv6 forwarding is not disabled by default and
then enabled only on master node.
Before this patch it was done in opposite way, so forwarding was
enabled by default and then disabled on backup nodes.
When forwarding was enabled/disabled for qg- port, MLDv2 packets are
sent and that might lead to temportary packets loss as packets to
FIP were sent to this backup node instead of master one.

Related-Bug: #1771841

Change-Id: Ia6b772e91c1f94612ca29d7082eca999372e60d6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 21:40:54.000000000', 'message': 'Metadata-API fails to retrieve avz for instances created before Pike

In Pike (through change: I8d426f2635232ffc4b510548a905794ca88d7f99)
we started setting instance.avilability_zone during schedule time by
calculating the avz of the host into which the instance was scheduled
into. After this change was introduced, the metadata request for the avz
on the instance (through change: I73c3b10e52ab4cfda9dacc0c0ba92d1fcb60bcc9)
started using instance.get(availability_zone) instead of doing the upcall.
However this would return None for instances older than Pike whose
availability_zone was not mentioned during boot time as it would be set to
CONF.default_schedule_zone whose default value is None.

This patch adds an online_migration tool to populate missing
instance.availability_zone values.

Change-Id: I2a1d81bfeb1ea006c16d8f403e045e9acedcbe57
Closes-Bug: #1768876
(cherry picked from commit 6b4c38c04177ff194d05368cd4aff69958075167)
'}]
commit_message:
Metadata-API fails to retrieve avz for instances created before Pike

In Pike (through change: I8d426f2635232ffc4b510548a905794ca88d7f99)
we started setting instance.avilability_zone during schedule time by
calculating the avz of the host into which the instance was scheduled
into. After this change was introduced, the metadata request for the avz
on the instance (through change: I73c3b10e52ab4cfda9dacc0c0ba92d1fcb60bcc9)
started using instance.get(availability_zone) instead of doing the upcall.
However this would return None for instances older than Pike whose
availability_zone was not mentioned during boot time as it would be set to
CONF.default_schedule_zone whose default value is None.

This patch adds an online_migration tool to populate missing
instance.availability_zone values.

Change-Id: I2a1d81bfeb1ea006c16d8f403e045e9acedcbe57
Closes-Bug: #1768876
(cherry picked from commit 6b4c38c04177ff194d05368cd4aff69958075167)

An update to the ceph config file should trigger a restart of the radosgw process (1). On the first run, the updated line in keystone.pp will add the parameter and set it to the value passed in. Typically the value will be 0 to disable pki revocation checking. A second run of module will not result in a change in the config file or a restart of the service. 

1: https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ceph/blob/master/manifests/rgw.pp#L197'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-05-23 21:05:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-05-24 04:12:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

OK with me, if it's okay with Tobias."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-06-03 16:49:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

I'm OK with this since it fixes a bug, generally interrupting service with restarts is bad IMO :) Thanks for fixing this!"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 08:25:10.000000000', 'message': 'Puppet incorrectly sets rgw_keystone_revocation_interval to absent

Puppet incorrectly sets rgw_keystone_revocation_interval when use_pki
is false. According to (1), the default value will be 15*60. This value
should be 0 when not using PKI tokens. This patch ensures the parameter
is set to the value passed into the module.

1: http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/radosgw/config-ref/

Change-Id: Ic8abf0c9d54847dad72824db211a5850737a05b8
Closes-bug: 1770234
(cherry picked from commit 16d2799998b6f550cbc8986731cb4683aa10b0d9)
'}]
commit_message:
Puppet incorrectly sets rgw_keystone_revocation_interval to absent

Puppet incorrectly sets rgw_keystone_revocation_interval when use_pki
is false. According to (1), the default value will be 15*60. This value
should be 0 when not using PKI tokens. This patch ensures the parameter
is set to the value passed into the module.

1: http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/radosgw/config-ref/

Change-Id: Ic8abf0c9d54847dad72824db211a5850737a05b8
Closes-bug: 1770234
(cherry picked from commit 16d2799998b6f550cbc8986731cb4683aa10b0d9)

commit_message:
Enhance network-attach command

Right now, the network-attach command supports attaching
a container to a network if given the network ID:

  zun network-attach <container> <network>

This PS adds support for attaching network with port
/IP address(es) as well:

  zun network-attach [--port <port>] [--network <network>]
                     [--fixed-ip <fixed_ip>] <container>

Related-Bug:#1746654
Depends-On: Ic7d3367f00b8cb034ee6d7d27962168e8cdc0a67
Change-Id: I9699a77e6cba5f1c83c9f9e70d5cd74cae9c87a0

We can remove it.

commit_message:
rename vars to defaults to allow overriding in ansible tests

After introducing support for setting ansible variables through
environment in ansible tests we need to further allow use of those. Set
ANSIBLE_VAR_FLAVOR=m1.large to redefine flavor variable in ansible test

Change-Id: I1f6b5b77ebd53ec0551b61851bf4fb618de0eb8f

commit_message:
Modify the unhelpful error message when delete network

Openstackclient returns a dump of the network object which is
unhelpful when Network delete error.
The patch deletes unhelpful object message and exposes real error
messages.
story: 2001973

Change-Id: Id3f20214d034848d36f9b6c8c9c73ef66ad26cdd
